operations.specification: Create a new section within the discussion board platform. This operation adds a section record in the 'discussionboard_sections' table, adhering strictly to the model definition in the Prisma schema. Each section requires the parent channel ID, a unique section code, a display name, an optional description, position, active status, and audit timestamps. The section is always linked to a parent channel and supports both UI ordering and archiving (via the 'active' boolean field). The API input and resulting object must not reference any fields that do not exist in the schema. Audit fields such as 'created_at' and 'updated_at' are written by the system, not by the user input. Only existing fields should be handled.
operations.description:
This endpoint creates a new section entity within the discussion board system.

All core fields must be provided: 'discussionboard_channel_id' (foreign key to channels), unique 'code', 'name' (string), optional 'description', UI 'position' (integer for navigation order), and 'active' (boolean flag for soft-archiving/enablement). System audit fields 'created_at' and 'updated_at' are handled automatically by the implementation. Section records support navigation hierarchy and permission scoping for boards/posts in the forum structure. No non-schema fields should be referenced. Only schema-defined parameters are supported. Returns the created section including all schema fields. Error is returned if any required field or uniqueness constraint fails. If the referenced channel does not exist, a foreign key error should be returned. No unrelated or missing fields should be referenced in either body or response.
operations.summary: Creates a new discussionboard_sections record in the system.

requestBody.description: Information required to create a discussionboard_sections record.

responseBody.description: The created section record with all schema fields populated.

Supports searching by section name, code, channel association, and active status, including ordering by position and pagination for scalable navigation. Only the schema-defined fields may be referenced; non-existent fields must not be handled. Request body must allow specifying filter, search, and pagination parameters as allowed, and output should include only objects defined in the schema.
operations.description:
This operation provides advanced retrieval and search of discussion board sections.

The endpoint supports filtering by fields such as name (with substring or trgm-op search support), code, parent channel (discussionboard_channel_id), and active status. It returns a paginated array of section objects conforming strictly to the Prisma schema. Requires proper index usage for efficient search and ordering (via 'position' or UI priority).

Request takes pagination (offset, limit), optional filters (name/code/active), and sort order. Returns a paginated list of section records as defined in the schema. Never returns any fields that do not exist (such as deleted_at, unless present in schema). Expected error for invalid filter or unknown parent channel. Uses only schema-allowed fields.

operations.specification: Search and retrieve a paginated list of notification templates for the discussion board system. This operation allows admin, moderator, or authorized personnel to filter and browse all available templates using flexible criteria. Templates are the reusable messages for notification delivery such as emails, in-app alerts, or push notifications. Filtering can be performed on fields like code, name, is_active, created_at, updated_at, or subject. Because this is a collection endpoint, it should support relevant search parameters and pagination for browsing large numbers of templates. Only fields ACTUALLY defined on the 'discussionboard_notification_templates' table can be referenced: id, code, name, description, subject, body, is_active, created_at, updated_at. No fields outside these (e.g., deleted_at) exist and must not be referenced.
operations.description:
This API lists notification templates stored in the notification message template master table (discussionboard_notification_templates). Each template contains attributes essential for system notification delivery, including its unique code, display name (name), subject, and body. Descriptions, is_active status, and timestamps (created_at, updated_at) are included only as defined in the schema. 

The operation enables advanced search by code, name, is_active, subject, or creation/update period, facilitating discovery or review by admins and moderators. It does NOT reference or return any field not present in the schema (e.g., no soft/hard delete indicator, no creator/editor tracking, no attachment support). Pagination and sorting parameters should be supported for scalable browsing.

Relevant use cases include admin browsing all templates, moderating notification content, performing audits on notification communications, and reviewing template versions before editing. Errors are returned for invalid queries or insufficient permissions. The database table does not support soft delete or restore, so only actual templates are listed - deleted ones (if any) are not available.

The request may include or omit admin remarks and will be routed for subsequent moderator/admin processing. Only schema-defined fields can be passed. Field presence and state transitions (e.g., reviewing, completing, denying) are managed through the 'status' string and audit timestamps, not a deleted_at field.

id.description:
Comment snapshot unique identifier.

References the primary key of the snapshot entity from the Prisma schema. Used for retrieving or referencing this snapshot version in audit and moderation workflows.

discussionboard_comment_id.description:
ID of the parent comment this snapshot is versioning.

Acts as a foreign key to the discussionboard_comments table, enforcing normalized snapshot history in the system design.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
ID of the user who authored the comment at the time of this snapshot.

This field allows for historical authorship tracking and supports accurate audit trail reporting when comments are edited or transferred.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
ID of the post under which this comment (snapshot) is associated.

Supports context linking even if post/comment relationships evolve over time.

body.description:
Immutable historical copy of the comment body at this version.

Stores the full comment content for rollback, moderation review, and audit. Preserves original wording even if edited later.

version.description:
Snapshot version number assigned per comment (monotonically increasing per edit event).

Allows for traceable edit history, recovery, and version sequencing. Based on strict normalization rules in DB design.

snapshot_created_at.description:
Timestamp when this snapshot was created.

Used for ordered audit, rollback recovery, and regulatory forensics.

IDiscussionboardCommentSnapshot.description:
Comment Snapshot entity representing an immutable, versioned record of a comment at a point in time.

Defined per the discussionboard_comment_snapshots Prisma schema model, supporting rollback, edit history, and audit trails in discussion moderation workflows.

discussionboard_comment_id.description: Parent comment's ID, to filter snapshots belonging to a given comment.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member ID for filtering snapshots by author at the time of version creation.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Post's ID, allowing filtration of versions for snapshots relating to a specific post.

version.description: Version number to filter for a specific edit version.

snapshot_created_at_from.description: Filter lower bound for snapshot creation datetime.

snapshot_created_at_to.description: Filter upper bound for snapshot creation datetime.

IDiscussionboardCommentSnapshot.IRequest.description:
Request type for searching/filtering comment snapshot records in the discussionboard_comment_snapshots table.

Allows flexible filtering by comment, author, post, version, or created at window, as per API and UI needs.

IPageIDiscussionboardCommentSnapshot.description:
Paginated result container for comment snapshot records.

Wraps a list of snapshots with standard pagination metadata, suitable for advanced UI browses and audits.

body.description:
Revised version of the comment body for the updated snapshot.

Content must comply with community guidelines and moderation rules.

version.description: Manually set or corrected version number for rare admin/appeal workflows only.

IDiscussionboardCommentSnapshot.IUpdate.description:
Update type for modifying allowed mutable fields in a comment snapshot record.

Typically only body and, rarely, version may change. For admin/appeal or audit-correction workflows, not user-level edits.

discussionboard_board_id.description:
Board reference for this settings row's ID. Each board has exactly one associated settings record; enforced via unique index (1:1). This UUID points to the discussionboard_boards table and ensures settings are strictly board-scoped.

Referenced from 'discussionboard_board_settings' in the Boards domain. Example: '9323dc7d-550f-4fbc-b254-9e89d2794217'.

is_locked.description: Boolean flag indicating whether the board is currently read-only (locked down for maintenance or moderation). Implements moderation/admin lockdown logic. 3NF: atomic flag per board. Example: false.

require_approval_for_posting.description: Indicates if new threads/posts require moderator/admin approval before publishing. Implements requirements for strict moderation boards. Example: true.

max_posts_per_hour.description: Max allowed new posts per user per hour for rate limiting and anti-spam. Example: 10.

allow_anonymous_viewing.description: If true, this board can be browsed by non-members (logged-out users). Controls accessibility and anonymous content consumption policies.

allow_file_uploads.description: Indicates whether users may attach/upload files in this board. Supports extended board configuration and compliance workflows.

pagination.description:
Page information.

Provides metadata about the current page, total records, page limits, and total pages, following standard discussionboard paging conventions. Supports scalable navigation and administrative review of snapshot version history.

data.description:
List of Post Snapshot records.

Contains the actual post snapshot objects, each of which represents a historical version of a post, including editor, version moment, and snapshot content per the snapshot schema.

IPageIPostSnapshot.description: Paginated result set for Post Snapshot records from the discussion board. Used for audit, rollback, and historical review functionality supporting compliance and advanced moderation workflows. Data is complete for each snapshot, and pagination enables efficient browsing through large version histories.

title.description: Snapshot of the post's title at the current version. Referencing the 'title' column in the discussionboard_post_snapshots schema, this property captures the post's heading as edited for rollback/compliance purposes.

body.description: Snapshot of the post's body content at this version. Matches the 'body' column in the post_snapshots table, for supporting moderation rollback and historical versioning.

taken_at.description:
Timestamp at which the snapshot was recorded, ISO 8601 format.

This field follows the 'taken_at' column in discussionboard_post_snapshots, denoting exactly when the snapshot was created for auditing and history tracking.

editor_member_id.description:
UUID of the member who edited the post at this version, nullable for system intervention.

This property is tied to the 'editor_member_id' column in discussionboard_post_snapshots, and indicates who performed the edit, supporting accountability, moderation, and audit trail.

Never give this property in response types if it refers to sensitive/impersonation data.

IPostSnapshot.IUpdate.description: Object for updating a Post Snapshot record, reflecting only mutable fields defined in the discussionboard_post_snapshots schema. Used for correcting audit errors, resolving moderation escalations, or rare admin operations. Only the directly schema-defined fields are modifiable; the post snapshot is generally considered immutable for typical user workflows.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
UUID referencing the post being voted on.

Implements the 'discussionboard_post_id' column in the discussionboard_post_votes schema. Required for associating the vote with the correct post and auditing the voting flow.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
UUID referencing the member who casts the vote.

Mapped to 'discussionboard_member_id' in the post_votes model, identifies the voter for permissions, uniqueness checks (one vote per member per post), and audit traceability.

oneOf.description:
The type of vote cast: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal.

Directly aligns with the 'vote_type' column (integer) in the discussionboard_post_votes schema, controlling post popularity and engagement analytics.

The type of vote cast: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal.

Directly aligns with the 'vote_type' column (integer) in the discussionboard_post_votes schema, controlling post popularity and engagement analytics.

The type of vote cast: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal.

Directly aligns with the 'vote_type' column (integer) in the discussionboard_post_votes schema, controlling post popularity and engagement analytics.

vote_type.description:
The type of vote cast: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal.

Directly aligns with the 'vote_type' column (integer) in the discussionboard_post_votes schema, controlling post popularity and engagement analytics.

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the vote was cast. Maps to 'created_at' column for audit, temporal analytics, and rate-limiting enforcement.

IPostVote.ICreate.description: Object required to create a new Post Vote record, referencing only properties in the discussionboard_post_votes Prisma schema. Used when a member submits an upvote, downvote, or neutralizes/removes their vote for a post. Submission must comply with the one-vote-per-member-per-post rule, and all fields are audit-critical for engagement monitoring.

id.description: Primary key for the post vote record. Uniquely identifies this vote in the discussionboard_post_votes table.

discussionboard_post_id.description: UUID referencing the post being voted on, as in the 'discussionboard_post_id' schema column. Essential for mapping votes to their respective content items.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID referencing the member who made the vote, matching the 'discussionboard_member_id' schema property. Used in enforcing unique voting, audit, rate limiting.

oneOf.description: Vote value: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal. Follows 'vote_type' column.
Vote value: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal. Follows 'vote_type' column.
Vote value: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal. Follows 'vote_type' column.

vote_type.description: Vote value: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal. Follows 'vote_type' column.

created_at.description: When the vote was created/cast. Matches 'created_at' column, supports time series/analytics.

IPostVote.description: A record representing a single member's upvote, downvote, or neutralization/removal for a post. Covers all schema-present columns and is essential for post engagement tracking, member interaction review, and anti-abuse mechanisms. Never contains derived, sensitive, or non-schema fields.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
Optional filter: target post UUID. Returns votes for this post.

Maps to the 'discussionboard_post_id' column of the post_votes table, enabling analytic or moderation queries for a post's engagement.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
Optional filter: member UUID. Returns votes made by this member, for profile history or moderation.

Refers to 'discussionboard_member_id' in the schema.

oneOf.description: Optional filter: specifies which type of votes to return (upvote, downvote, or neutral). Used for reviewing only positive/negative feedback, or neutralizations.
Optional filter: specifies which type of votes to return (upvote, downvote, or neutral). Used for reviewing only positive/negative feedback, or neutralizations.
Optional filter: specifies which type of votes to return (upvote, downvote, or neutral). Used for reviewing only positive/negative feedback, or neutralizations.

vote_type.description: Optional filter: specifies which type of votes to return (upvote, downvote, or neutral). Used for reviewing only positive/negative feedback, or neutralizations.

created_at.description: Optional filter: when the vote was cast. Allows time-based analysis in analytic dashboards.

IPostVote.IRequest.description: Request type for searching, filtering, or paginating post vote records. Accepts only fields that exist in the discussionboard_post_votes Prisma schema for secure and type-safe queries.

pagination.description: Metadata about the current page, total records, page count, and limit, supporting navigation through large vote records as per standard paging conventions for scalable retrievals.

data.description: List of post vote records for this page. Each item is a schema-complete description of an individual member's vote on a specific post, audit-ready for administrative or moderator analysis.

IPageIPostVote.description: Paginated result envelope for a list of Post Vote records, providing page navigation details and an array of schema-accurate vote objects for profile, moderation, or analytics use cases.

oneOf.description:
The updated vote value for this record: 1 (upvote), -1 (downvote), or 0 (neutral).

Follows the 'vote_type' column in post_votes schema. Used by admin/moderator to correct voting actions, handle abuse, or recover from user error.

The updated vote value for this record: 1 (upvote), -1 (downvote), or 0 (neutral).

Follows the 'vote_type' column in post_votes schema. Used by admin/moderator to correct voting actions, handle abuse, or recover from user error.

The updated vote value for this record: 1 (upvote), -1 (downvote), or 0 (neutral).

Follows the 'vote_type' column in post_votes schema. Used by admin/moderator to correct voting actions, handle abuse, or recover from user error.

vote_type.description:
The updated vote value for this record: 1 (upvote), -1 (downvote), or 0 (neutral).

Follows the 'vote_type' column in post_votes schema. Used by admin/moderator to correct voting actions, handle abuse, or recover from user error.

created_at.description:
The updated timestamp for when the vote was cast (optional, for correcting audit/compliance issues).

Corresponds to the 'created_at' column. Generally modified only by admins/mods.

IPostVote.IUpdate.description: Object used to update a member's vote on a post, only for fields present in the post_votes schema. Allows fixing vote_type due to moderation or error; rarely modified except in compliance scenarios.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
UUID of the post being reported as problematic for moderation workflows.

Implements the 'discussionboard_post_id' column in the post_reports Prisma table. Required for linking the report to the correct post entity.

reporter_member_id.description: UUID of the member filing the report. Follows 'reporter_member_id' column in schema, securing audit trail and enforcing moderation flow rules.

report_type_id.description:
UUID referencing the reason or category for report (e.g., spam, abuse, misinformation).

Maps to the 'report_type_id' schema column, which is a foreign key to the list of allowed report types, enabling analytic breakdown and reporting workflow dispatch.

description.description:
Optional reporter-supplied context or descriptive explanation for the report. Nullable in schema.

Matches the 'description' column; supports nuanced case handling and moderation transparency.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the report was created, as in 'created_at' column. Holds the date/time for reporting, required for audit, compliance, and sequencing moderation reviews.

IPostReport.ICreate.description: Object for creating a new post report record, as stored in the discussionboard_post_reports table. Each field is tied directly to the schema documentation and is critical for ensuring tracing, reporting, and compliance in the moderation workflow. Reports inappropriate, abusive, or spam content on a post for investigation by moderators or admin.

id.description: Primary key for the post report record in the discussionboard_post_reports table. Unique identifier for this individual report.

discussionboard_post_id.description: UUID referencing the reported post. Required for mapping the report within the moderation workflow.

reporter_member_id.description: UUID representing the member who filed this report, as in 'reporter_member_id' column. Needed for moderation/audit transparency.

report_type_id.description: UUID reference to the report reason/category ('report_type_id' column), tied to a valid moderation report type.

description.description: Nullable string: the explanation or context for the report. As in 'description' column. May be empty if report is by quick-action/report button.

created_at.description: Record creation timestamp, ISO 8601, matching 'created_at' column. Required for audit, compliance, and report reviews.

IPostReport.description: Atomic record of a member-submitted report against a post, stored in the discussionboard_post_reports schema. Directly supports content moderation, audit investigation, and anti-abuse policies. Contains all schema-defined fields and no sensitive or non-existent properties.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
Optional filter to get reports for a specific post (UUID).

Used in moderator review queue or post-centric analytics.

reporter_member_id.description:
Optional filter for all reports filed by a particular member.

Tied to 'reporter_member_id' column of the schema.

report_type_id.description:
Optional filter by reason/category of report (as in 'report_type_id' column).

Matches foreign key for type analytics and workflow split.

created_at.description:
Optional filter for timestamp (ISO 8601) when the report was recorded.

Permits analytic/temporal queries in moderation dashboards.

IPostReport.IRequest.description: Request type for searching, filtering, or paginating post report records by schema-supported columns. Used by moderator/admin for compliance, investigation, or workflow management of reported posts.

pagination.description: Metadata for the current page, supporting scaling through large report records as required by moderator/audit access.

data.description: The collection of individual post report records for this page, each matching the schema precisely for audit, review, and workflow triage.

IPageIPostReport.description: Paginated page envelope containing post report records for moderator/admin review. Supports scalable workflows, audit queries, compliance snapshots, and member appeal workflows, all by exposing only schema-present fields.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Optional: update the reported post reference in rare workflows (e.g., admin correction or dispute resolution).

reporter_member_id.description: Optional: update the reporting member reference if correcting administrative errors or transfer of responsibility.

report_type_id.description: Update the category of the report, e.g. if a moderator reclassifies the incident. See report_type_id in schema.

description.description: Allows for editing the explanatory text/context, especially in response to appeals or moderator corrections.

IPostReport.IUpdate.description: Object for updating allowed fields on a post report record. Only modifiable for rare moderation/audit corrections; general user workflows should treat all fields as immutable.

limit.description:
Limit of records per page.

@default 100

pages.description: Total pages available, equal to records/limit with ceiling.

IPage.IPagination.description: Pagination metadata as required for paged list responses supporting consistent navigation and scaling in discussionboard API.

id.description: Primary key for the post snapshot entry in the discussionboard_post_snapshots table, used for retrieval, version audit, or rollback.

discussionboard_post_id.description: UUID referencing the parent post whose version this snapshot represents. Required in all version audit, rollback, and compliance queries.

editor_member_id.description: UUID for the member who made the edit, if available (nullable for system-generated). Used for accountability and audit trails. Null when snapshot is created by system/admin. DO NOT expose in cases where this could violate impersonation security policies.

title.description: Snapshot of the post's title as persisted in this version. Atomic and immutable after creation.

body.description: Textual content of the post at this snapshot version. Immutable, for rollback/review purposes.

taken_at.description:
Timestamp recording when the snapshot was taken.

Ensures auditability and enables precise version comparisons/restorations.

IPostSnapshot.description: Represents a historical record of a post's content for audit, rollback, and compliance in the discussion board. Used in version history panels, moderator investigations, and disputed content appeals. All fields are first-class, schema-driven table columns; no sensitive or system-only data included.

IDiscussionboardThreads.ICreate.description:
Request schema for creating a new thread in the discussion board (discussionboard_threads table). This type represents the data required to initialize a thread, strictly derived from the Prisma schema and ERD.

All properties should be matched to the corresponding columns of the database table, ensuring database-level constraints and business rules. This type omits auto-generated and system-managed fields, and NEVER allows the client to specify actor/ownership fields not in the schema (such as created_by or author_id, unless specifically present). Ownership and timestamps should be system-resolved except where allowed by schema.

- board_id: Board wherein the thread is posted.
- author_member_id: The creator (must match authentication context, not from body in secure production use).
- title: Thread title (must be unique per board, as per Prisma constraint).
- body: Optional description/body content.

board_id.description: UUID referencing the parent board (discussionboard_boards.id). Required by schema, enables navigation and access constraint.

author_member_id.description:
UUID referencing the member (discussionboard_members.id) who creates the thread. Foreign keyâ€”must exist in actors table. Ownership, for audit and moderation.

NOTE: In production, this should ONLY be derived from the authentication context, not settable by the client directly, to prevent impersonation risks.

title.description: Required thread title. Uniquely identifies the thread within a board (enforced by Prisma unique constraint on [board_id, title]). Used for thread navigation and display.

oneOf.description: Optional main thread body/content (nullable in schema). May be omitted if thread is a simple subject line. Used for first-post introduction or context, matched to ERD.

body.description: Optional main thread body/content (nullable in schema). May be omitted if thread is a simple subject line. Used for first-post introduction or context, matched to ERD.

IDiscussionboardThreads.description:
Full thread entity as stored in the discussionboard_threads table. Used for response bodies when retrieving full thread information. Derived strictly from the Prisma schema and ERD. Sensitive/internal fields (such as moderation or deleted_by data) are omitted unless present in the schema.

This type provides all properties available on a normal SELECT; these include linkage, timestamps, and soft deletion tracking if available. NEVER includes password or security fields.

Links to board (by id), author, and version tracking.

- id: Thread UUID.
- board_id: Reference to parent board.
- author_member_id: Author (poster, member).
- title/body: Core content fields.
- created_at/updated_at: Timestamps.
- deleted_at: Null unless soft-deleted.

id.description: Primary key (UUID) for this thread entity.

board_id.description: Foreign key: which board this thread belongs to.

author_member_id.description: Foreign key: authoring member of this thread.

title.description: The thread titleâ€”see schema and requirements for uniqueness and display rules.

oneOf.description: Optional body/description text for the thread subject (nullable in schema, may be empty for brief threads).

body.description: Optional body/description text for the thread subject (nullable in schema, may be empty for brief threads).

created_at.description: Timestamp when this thread was created (ISO 8601 format). Field used for creation ordering, audit, and timeline view.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the most recent edit to this thread. Used for ordering, audit, and UX 'edited' marker.

oneOf.description: Nullable soft delete marker. Set if thread is deleted (moved to deleted state, not removed from DB). Null if live. Field for moderation, audit, or restore.

deleted_at.description: Nullable soft delete marker. Set if thread is deleted (moved to deleted state, not removed from DB). Null if live. Field for moderation, audit, or restore.

IDiscussionboardThreads.IRequest.description:
Thread search/filter/pagination request object. Used in PATCH endpoints to find/filter/list threads in the discussionboard_threads table per business requirements.

Properties provide advanced filtering options: e.g. search by board, author, time window, deletion status. Pagination fields may refer to platform's IPage.IRequest contract.

- board_id: Filter by parent board.
- author_member_id: Filter by author.
- title: Text search (exact/partial).
- created_at_from/created_at_to: Time range boundaries.
- deleted: Boolean toggle to include/exclude soft-deleted records.
- page/limit: Pagination controls.

oneOf.description: Optional: limit to threads within this board.

board_id.description: Optional: limit to threads within this board.

oneOf.description: Optional: filter threads by author id (actor/member).

author_member_id.description: Optional: filter threads by author id (actor/member).

oneOf.description: Optional: Filter by exact or partial match on thread title.

title.description: Optional: Filter by exact or partial match on thread title.

oneOf.description: Optional: lower bound (inclusive) for creation timestamp.

created_at_from.description: Optional: lower bound (inclusive) for creation timestamp.

oneOf.description: Optional: upper bound (inclusive) for creation timestamp.

created_at_to.description: Optional: upper bound (inclusive) for creation timestamp.

oneOf.description: When true, only soft-deleted threads are listed. When false, only non-deleted threads. When omitted/null, both are included.

deleted.description: When true, only soft-deleted threads are listed. When false, only non-deleted threads. When omitted/null, both are included.

oneOf.description: Pagination: Page number (1-based).

page.description: Pagination: Page number (1-based).

oneOf.description: Pagination: Max records per page.

limit.description: Pagination: Max records per page.

IPageIDiscussionboardThreads.description:
A paginated result type of thread entities (IPage<IDiscussionboardThreads>). Standard list view with result array and pagination metadata as in platform IPage contract.

- pagination: Object containing page, limit, total record count, total pages.
- data: Array of thread records for the selected page/filters.

data.description: Array of thread objects for this page.

IDiscussionboardThreads.IUpdate.description:
Patch/update schema for a thread entity in the discussionboard_threads table.

Applicable to PUT/patch endpoints. Only schema-defined fields are included; system or audit fields are not present except as required. For security, client cannot update ownership or audit trail fields directly (e.g., cannot change author_member_id unless allowed by business logic).

- title: Updated thread title.
- body: Updated/overwritten thread body/description.

oneOf.description: (Optional) New/edited title for the thread.

title.description: (Optional) New/edited title for the thread.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Updated thread main content, can be set to null or overwritten.

body.description: (Optional) Updated thread main content, can be set to null or overwritten.

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots.ICreate.description:
Schema for posting a new thread snapshot in the discussionboard_thread_snapshots table.

Records a version of the thread's state at a given point. Used during edit, moderation, or rollback workflows. Only schema columns: thread_id, actor_id, title, optional body, optional reason.

oneOf.description: Optional: UUID of actor (member causing this version). May be system/null if auto-edit.

actor_id.description: Optional: UUID of actor (member causing this version). May be system/null if auto-edit.

title.description: Snapshot of thread title at version point.

oneOf.description: Optional thread body at time of snapshot.

body.description: Optional thread body at time of snapshot.

oneOf.description: Optional moderator/user reason for this snapshot (e.g., edit, rule violation, rollback note).

reason.description: Optional moderator/user reason for this snapshot (e.g., edit, rule violation, rollback note).

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots.description:
Represents a versioned record of a thread's state (discussionboard_thread_snapshots table).

Contains all recorded fields: id, thread_id, actor_id (nullable), title, body (nullable), reason (nullable), created_at.

id.description: Unique id for this snapshot.

oneOf.description: Null/system or actor for this snapshot, if recorded.

actor_id.description: Null/system or actor for this snapshot, if recorded.

title.description: Thread title at this version.

oneOf.description: Thread body at this version.

body.description: Thread body at this version.

oneOf.description: Versioning reason/moderation note/audit field.

reason.description: Versioning reason/moderation note/audit field.

created_at.description: Timestamp this snapshot was created.

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots.IRequest.description:
Request schema for listing/searching thread snapshots (discussionboard_thread_snapshots). Used to filter/audit version history.

Provides filtering/searching by thread, actor, time, and support for pagination.
- thread_id: Filter by target thread.
- actor_id: Filter by editing actor.
- created_at_from/to: Time range narrowing.
- page/limit: Pagination.

oneOf.description: Optional: limit to snapshots for this thread.

thread_id.description: Optional: limit to snapshots for this thread.

oneOf.description: Optional: limit to snapshots created by this actor.

actor_id.description: Optional: limit to snapshots created by this actor.

oneOf.description: Optional: filter snapshots after this date/time.

created_at_from.description: Optional: filter snapshots after this date/time.

oneOf.description: Optional: filter snapshots before this date/time.

created_at_to.description: Optional: filter snapshots before this date/time.

oneOf.description: Pagination: page number.

page.description: Pagination: page number.

oneOf.description: Pagination: max per page.

limit.description: Pagination: max per page.

IPageIDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots.description: Paginated envelope of thread snapshot records (IPage<IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots>). Standard IPage structure: pagination meta + record list.

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshot.IUpdate.description:
Update schema for editing a thread snapshot record. Only updatable schema fields are referenced.

May only permit updates to nullable fields (body, reason); id/thread_id/title are typically immutable for audit compliance.
- body: Corrected/updated version text.
- reason: Clarified/more detailed rationale for versioning.

Note: Edits may be locked in production deployments for audit trust.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Overwrite/correct thread body at this snapshot version.

body.description: (Optional) Overwrite/correct thread body at this snapshot version.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Correction/annotation for version edit reason.

reason.description: (Optional) Correction/annotation for version edit reason.

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshot.description:
Minimal view for a single thread snapshotâ€”for pure audit or retrieval purposes (IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots, non-list form). Matches details from the main table.

- id: Unique record.
- thread_id: Parent thread.
- actor_id: Editor (nullable/system).
- title/body/reason: Main fields.
- created_at: Snapshot timestamp.

IDiscussionboardThreadTag.ICreate.description:
Request schema for associating a tag with a thread (discussionboard_thread_tags).

Establishes the M:N relation between a thread and a tag. Only referenced schema fields are present: thread_id and assigned_at are required; removed_at is optional/null for active.

- thread_id: Target thread (UUID).
- assigned_at: Time of tag assignment.
- removed_at: When tag was removed; null if active.

assigned_at.description: When the tag was assigned to the thread (audit/history field).

oneOf.description: When (if) the tag was later removed from this thread. Null if still active.

removed_at.description: When (if) the tag was later removed from this thread. Null if still active.

IPage.IPagination.description:
Page information for paginated results.

Follows IPage.IPagination standard from Samchon @autobe API documentation.

- current: Current page number.
- limit: Limitation of records per page (default 100).
- records: Total number of records in the database (across all pages).
- pages: Total number of pages (records/limit, ceiling).

current.description: Current page number (uint32 type, starts at 1). Always required.

limit.description: Max records per page (uint32 type).

id.description:
Unique identifier for each trending topic record, referenced throughout the analytics/trending subsystems of the forum platform. Sourced from the discussionboard_trending_topics table, this field provides a single, atomic PK for each daily or periodic trending score. Never null or re-used.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.id

discussionboard_thread_id.description:
Foreign key reference to the thread judged trending (discussionboard_threads.id). This attribute fulfills the connection between analytics and user discussion content, supporting UI panels, notification engines, and audit trails.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.discussionboard_thread_id

discussionboard_board_id.description:
Foreign key reference to the board (discussionboard_boards.id) under which the trending topic is computed and visualized. Enables board-level trending panels and analytics breakdowns for navigation purposes.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.discussionboard_board_id

ranking_period_date.description:
Date/time value representing the period for which the topic is trending (e.g., daily partition). Supports analytics roll-ups and enables accurate visualizations across dashboards.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.ranking_period_date

trending_score.description:
Quantitative value reflecting engagement weight, as calculated by analytics engine or background jobs, relative to a forum thread within the period. Used for ordering trending results and alerting moderation.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.trending_score

IDiscussionboardTrendingTopic.description: Represents a single trending topic as calculated for analytics and trending panels. Sourced from the discussionboard_trending_topics Prisma table and referenced in the analytics and moderation dashboards. Contains quantitative and relational fields crucial for surfacing active forum subjects.

code.description:
Unique, short programmatic reference code for the notification template. This is used in notification jobs and must be globally unique and immutable.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.code

name.description:
Human-readable title for the notification template, used for administrative panel labeling, review, and template configuration workflows.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.name

oneOf.description:
Long-form description for admins/moderators clarifying the purpose of the template, its context, and operational constraints. Optional.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.description

description.description:
Long-form description for admins/moderators clarifying the purpose of the template, its context, and operational constraints. Optional.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.description

subject.description:
Subject line for notification messages using this template. Required for all standard notification template creation.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.subject

body.description:
The template body in full, including parameter placeholders. Not nullable.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.body

is_active.description: Determines template availability for notification triggering (enabled/disabled for API use; required as a direct field @see discussionboard_notification_templates.is_active).

IDiscussionboardNotificationTemplate.ICr.description: Request body for creating a new notification message template. All major business and audit fields for template creation are present and values must conform to discussionboard_notification_templates Prisma schema.

id.description:
Globally unique identifier for this notification template record, serving as the primary key for template versioning, auditing, and referencing from delivery jobs and logs.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.id

code.description:
Short, unique code for the template used for backend lookups, mapping downstream logic to the correct template record for rendering and notification dispatching.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.code

name.description:
Human-friendly title for displaying notification templates in admin tools and analytics dashboards. Not nullable.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.name

oneOf.description:
Long-form (optional) explanation for admin reference, describing template's intent, scope, and usage notes for future support.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.description

description.description:
Long-form (optional) explanation for admin reference, describing template's intent, scope, and usage notes for future support.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.description

subject.description:
Actual subject line as rendered to users in emails or push notifications. Supports personalization markup as necessary.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.subject

body.description:
Text or markup field containing the message body, possibly with template placeholders for personalization. Required as non-null.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.body

is_active.description:
Flag determining whether this template is currently available for use in notifications. Admin/moderator toggles are provided via this field.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.is_active

created_at.description:
Timestamp when this notification template was created, for audit, timeline review, and compliance tracking.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.created_at

updated_at.description:
Timestamp for the most recent modification to this template; supports support tooling and compliance review.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.updated_at

IDiscussionboardNotificationTemplate.description: Notification template entity containing all schema-compliant fields as stored in the discussionboard_notification_templates table. Used for display, auditing, and notification rendering workflows.

id.description: Optional filter for searching by primary key. Narrows query to specific template record if provided.

code.description: Optional. Allows filtering by unique template code for advanced/targeted queries.

name.description: Allows searching or filtering results by human-friendly template name string.

subject.description: Optionally filter or search for templates based on subject line substrings or fuzzy match.

is_active.description: Enables filtering templates by their active state (true for currently enabled, false for disabled/inactive).

created_at_from.description: Returns templates created after this timestamp for time-range queries.

created_at_to.description: Returns templates created before this timestamp for bounded-date queries.

updated_at_from.description: Filters templates updated after this time for change/recent edit review.

updated_at_to.description: Filters templates updated before this value for change window search.

page.description: Page number for paginated query (starting from 1).

limit.description: Number of results per page for pagination.

IDiscussionboardNotificationTemplate.IRe.description: Request type for paged or filtered notification template search, matching all key columns in the template schema. Used for admin/moderator dashboard and support tooling.

pagination.description: Pagination information for the page response, including current page, per-page record count, total records, and pages.

data.description: Array of notification template records for the page, each an atomic entity matching the notification template table schema.

IPageDiscussionboardNotificationTemplate.description: Paginated wrapper object for notification template search/list responses as returned to admin/moderator dashboards for browsing.

code.description: Updated unique code for the template. Optional, but if present must not violate code uniqueness constraint in the table.

name.description: Updated human-friendly title for the template.

oneOf.description: Modified or replacement long-form template description text. Optional.

description.description: Modified or replacement long-form template description text. Optional.

subject.description: Updated subject line string for notification messages sent from this template.

body.description: Updated template message body for notifications.

is_active.description: Flag to set template visibility/enabled status in notification jobs.

IDiscussionboardNotificationTemplate.IUp.description: Request type for updating attributes of a notification template in the admin panel. Only schema-allowed columns are present.

success.description: Indicates whether the operation was successful (true) or not (false). Used for confirming deletion or other boolean-result actions.

message.description: Optional, human-readable explanation for the result of an operation. Allows conveying status or error explanation as needed.

IBoolResult.description: Simple result format for confirming/denying boolean actions (such as deletion of records).

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID reference to the member to which this notification preference record belongs. Must match an active user in the discussionboard_members table. Required for all creations.

code.description: Notification template code identifying the type of notification this preference controls. Used for mapping multiple preferences per template/channel.

email_enabled.description: Boolean for enabling/disabling email channel notifications for this template code and user.

inapp_enabled.description: Boolean for enabling/disabling in-app (bell) notifications for this preference.

browser_enabled.description: Boolean to enable/disable browser push for this template preference.

IDiscussionboardNotificationPreference.I.description: Notification preference creation request. Used for inserting a new row to discussionboard_notification_preferences for per-member/template/channel configuration.

id.description: Globally unique identifier for the notification preference row. Serves as primary key for per-member/template/channel configuration and supports update/deletion and audit workflows.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID referencing the member this preference belongs to. Foreign key to discussionboard_members.id.

code.description: Code for the notification template this preference applies to.

email_enabled.description: Specifies whether email channel notifications should be sent using this template to the user.

inapp_enabled.description: Specifies whether in-app/bell notifications are enabled for this template and user.

browser_enabled.description: Specifies whether browser push notifications are enabled for this template and user.

created_at.description: Timestamp when this notification preference record was created, for audit/compliance support.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for last change of this notification preference record.

IDiscussionboardNotificationPreference.description: Atomic entity describing a notification channel/template preference entry, as persisted in the notification preference table.

id.description: Optional: filter for searching by primary key if known.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Filter/search on the member id owning this preference (UUID of user).

code.description: Filter by template code for targeted search.

email_enabled.description: Optionally filter by email enabled state.

inapp_enabled.description: Optionally filter by in-app enabled state.

browser_enabled.description: Optional filter to match records with this browser push state.

created_at_from.description: Returns rows with created_at >= this value for time-range search.

created_at_to.description: Returns rows with created_at <= this value for bounded queries.

updated_at_from.description: Filter for last update time greater than or equal to this timestamp.

updated_at_to.description: Filter for last update time less than or equal to this timestamp.

page.description: Requested page for pagination controls.

limit.description: Results per page for paging applications.

IDiscussionboardNotificationPreference.I.description: Notification preference search/filter request structure using all relevant fields from the table.

pagination.description: Metadata and controls for the pageâ€”current/total page, record count, etc.

data.description: Atomic notification preference records for the page. Each entry matches the persisted row structure and schema of notification preference.

IPageDiscussionboardNotificationPreferen.description: Paginated response envelope for notification preference browse/search APIs.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
The unique identifier for the member (user) whose notification/channel preference is being updated. This field links the notification preference record to the appropriate user entity (see Actors component). Set automatically when members update their own preferences; may be required/admin-editable for administrative updates.

References the member's id in the 'discussionboard_members' table as a foreign key. Used for scoping this preference to a particular user. Always a UUID value.

code.description:
Notification Template Code. Specifies for which template or notification topic this preference applies (e.g., 'thread_reply', 'mention_alert'). Must correspond to a valid notification template code in the system.

Ensures preferences are associated with specific system messages and supports granular per-template and per-channel controls. Follows normalized notification management as described in the main requirements and schema docs. Typically unique per (member_id, code) pair.

email_enabled.description: True if email notifications for this template/code are enabled for this member; false if email should not be sent for this topic. Implements member-level custom delivery control: users may opt in or out of email for each notification scenario. Used to comply with privacy and anti-spam regulations.

inapp_enabled.description: True if in-app/bell notifications are enabled for this code for this member; false otherwise. Allows members to suppress or enable UI notification pop-ups or notification center entries for specific templates. Implements fine-grained control and aligns with system notification behaviour.

browser_enabled.description: True if browser push notifications should be used for this template/code. Gives the user full choice over using browser-based push notifications for the associated topic. Integral part of user experience customization.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this notification preference was created. Required for compliance and audit. Follows standard ISO 8601 date-time format as described in the schema.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp for the latest modification to this preference record. Updated automatically when member or admin changes preferences. Enforces audit/compliance as required by system policies.

ISO 8601 format.

IDiscussionboardNotificationPreference.I.description:
Request body or update object schema for updating a discussion board notification preference. This type describes the fields a member or admin is allowed to update on a notification preference record, supporting granular per-template/per-channel opt-in/opt-out of notification delivery channels (email, in-app, browser push).

Each field is explained in context of notification routing as outlined in the requirements and schema documentation. All references are to system-internal ids and codes, following normalized notification and preference models. The business rules require that any updates to notification preferences pass the full set of schema validations (UUIDs, code structure, booleans). This component is integral to notification settings panels, privacy controls, and compliance dashboards for the discussion board platform.

version.description:
Policy version identifier.

A unique, structured identifier describing the version of the privacy policy (e.g., 'v2024.06'). Must be unique and is referenced in logs, consent, and audit trails. Required by the business for regulatory compliance and historical review.

effective_date.description:
Effective start date for this policy version.

Must be in ISO 8601 date-time format and represents the timestamp when this policy becomes active. Required for regulatory time-based traceability and determines which version is active when a user joins.

title.description:
Policy title/heading.

A short, descriptive title for this version of the privacy policy (e.g., "Discussion Board Privacy Statement - 2025 Update"). Used to identify the policy in UI listings and legal documents.

content.description:
Full legal/privacy policy text.

The full authoritative text of the privacy and data protection policy as required by law and business rules. Displayed to users in legal/compliance interfaces, never truncated or summarized.

IDiscussionboardPrivacyPolicy.ICreate.description:
Creation object for a new privacy policy version.

All fields are required to establish a legally binding and traceable policy entry. Each record is immutable and a new version is inserted when updating. This structure is compliant with business/legal audits.

id.description:
Primary Key: Unique identifier for this privacy policy version.

Auto-generated and used for system/DB reference.

version.description:
Policy version string (e.g., 'v2024.06').

Uniquely identifies each version for historical lookup, database audit, and user consent verification.

effective_date.description:
Datetime this policy became effective (ISO 8601).

Used for time-based compliance, determining which policy covers a user at the time of their consent/account creation.

title.description:
Short heading/title for the privacy policy.

Displayable in UI and referenced in logs, user audit/history workflows.

content.description:
Full policy text.

Authoritative and complete legal description for data use, rights, retention, and other privacy matters.

created_at.description:
Creation timestamp for this policy version (ISO 8601).

Database/audit field for record keeping.

updated_at.description:
Last update timestamp for this record.

Audit field for history/compliance; updates only on changes to this row.

IDiscussionboardPrivacyPolicy.description:
Atomically represents a single privacy policy version.

Fields are referenced directly in privacy/legal screens, consent UIs, admin dashboards, and compliance data exports. Immutable except for admin updates.

version.description:
Search or filter for a given policy version.

Filters for exact matches to a version code/identifier (e.g., 'v2024.06').

effective_date.description:
Filter by effective date (e.g., show only policies effective after this date).

ISO 8601 format, supports range/bounds queries in admin UI.

title.description:
Filter by title substring, optionally with full-text or trigram search.

Used to narrow policy listings by semantic context or keywords.

created_at.description:
Created at (for filtering or range search)

ISO 8601 date-time. Used in audit dashboards or when listing only recent policy updates.

updated_at.description:
Updated at timestamp (range query/search)

ISO 8601 date-time, range/bound filter.

IDiscussionboardPrivacyPolicy.IRequest.description:
Search/filter/pagination object for privacy policy admin pages and compliance exports.

All fields are optional and exactly match those present in the table for safe, compliant querying.

data.description: Page-wise array of privacy policy records.

IPageDiscussionboardPrivacyPolicy.description:
Paginated response/result object for privacy policy records.

Used for admin dashboards, audit search, compliance/reporting. Follows system standard for paged collections.

version.description:
New version identifier, if updating.

Supports correcting a version typo, or retroactively version-bumping for regulatory update (rare / admin-only field).

effective_date.description: Update to the effective date (ISO 8601), typically for retroactive compliance or error correction.

title.description: Optional update of policy title. Used only for minor corrections or rebranding.

content.description: Replacement policy text (full). Use only when legally updating the text, not for minor clarifications.

created_at.description: Backdated creation timestamp, if correcting for compliance/history (rare; admin-only).

updated_at.description: Sets the updated timestamp explicitly (normally system-managed; only for audit fix-ups).

Idiscussionboard_privacy_policies.IUpdat.description:
Update information for privacy policy record.

All fields are optional and may be provided individually for patch/update scenarios. Intended for admin-level use with extreme care and full audit logging.

id.description:
Primary Key: Unique identifier for this privacy policy version.

Auto-generated and used for system/DB reference.

version.description:
Policy version string (e.g., 'v2024.06').

Uniquely identifies each version for historical lookup, database audit, and user consent verification.

effective_date.description:
Datetime this policy became effective (ISO 8601).

Used for time-based compliance, determining which policy covers a user at the time of their consent/account creation.

title.description:
Short heading/title for the privacy policy.

Displayable in UI and referenced in logs, user audit/history workflows.

content.description:
Full policy text.

Authoritative and complete legal description for data use, rights, retention, and other privacy matters.

created_at.description:
Creation timestamp for this policy version (ISO 8601).

Database/audit field for record keeping.

updated_at.description:
Last update timestamp for this record.

Audit field for history/compliance; updates only on changes to this row.

Idiscussionboard_privacy_policies.description: Fully represents a privacy policy record with all required fields and descriptive details for audit, compliance, and UI/legal display.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
ID of the member submitting the erasure request.

Foreign key to members table â€“ ensures request links to identity for audit/compliance.

status.description:
Initial status string for the erasure request.

Examples: 'pending', 'approved', 'denied', 'completed'

May be set by the initial submitter (typically 'pending') or by an admin if bootstrapping a migrated request.

requested_at.description:
Timestamp when the erasure was requested.

ISO 8601, set to now unless re-importing or correcting audit history.

oneOf.description:
Optional admin comment/remark.

May be set at creation (for admin-initiated requests) or null if not supplied by a member.

Optional admin comment/remark.

May be set at creation (for admin-initiated requests) or null if not supplied by a member.

admin_remark.description:
Optional admin comment/remark.

May be set at creation (for admin-initiated requests) or null if not supplied by a member.

Idiscussionboard_data_erasure_requests.I.description:
Input object for creating a data erasure request.

Compliant with GDPR/CCPA and internal compliance: member, status, and timestamp required. Admin remark is optional.

id.description:
Primary Key: unique identifier for this erasure request.

Used for tracking, audit, and compliance reporting.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
FK to discussionboard_members, identifying request owner.

Required for all audit, compliance, and data processing workflows.

status.description:
Current status string for the erasure request.

Allowed values include: 'pending', 'approved', 'denied', 'completed', etc. State machine is enforced elsewhere; this field is atomic and always up-to-date for recordkeeping.

oneOf.description:
When request was reviewed by admin/mod (nullable).

Remains null if never reviewed; audit-compliant.

When request was reviewed by admin/mod (nullable).

Remains null if never reviewed; audit-compliant.

reviewed_at.description:
When request was reviewed by admin/mod (nullable).

Remains null if never reviewed; audit-compliant.

oneOf.description:
When request processing was completed (approved/denied/fulfilled).

Nullable for incomplete/pending requests.

When request processing was completed (approved/denied/fulfilled).

Nullable for incomplete/pending requests.

completed_at.description:
When request processing was completed (approved/denied/fulfilled).

Nullable for incomplete/pending requests.

oneOf.description: Admin-provided note for audit trail, compliance explanation, or legal record. Nullable.
Admin-provided note for audit trail, compliance explanation, or legal record. Nullable.

admin_remark.description: Admin-provided note for audit trail, compliance explanation, or legal record. Nullable.

Idiscussionboard_data_erasure_requests.description:
Atomic data record representing a single data erasure request.

All fields captured directly from DB, providing a full history for audit, compliance, dashboard/review, and deletion workflow progress tracking.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
Filter to show only requests from a specific member.

Use in member self-service dashboards/audits, or for admin querying of an individual user.

status.description:

Required for transparency, as per the schema doc: 'Warning reason, descriptive text stating the violation or risk observed.'

warned_at.description: ISO 8601/RFC3339 datetimestamp of when this warning was officially applied. Enforces single source of truth for timeline computation, audit, and escalation automation. Schema: 'Timestamp when warning was applied.'

IDiscussionboardWarning.description:
Represents an issued warning in the discussion board system. Each record captures a single official warning to a member, referencing the subject member (warned_member_id), the issuing moderator or admin (acting_moderator_id), an optional report (report_id) that triggered the warning, the reason for the warning (reason), and the precise issue time (warned_at).

This schema is fully aligned with the @discussionboard_warnings Prisma model, which implements the warning step of the moderation and escalation pipeline. All fields are atomic (UUID/text/date) and enable audit trails, compliance with business rules, and tracking of moderation escalation or appeals. Mutable fields (such as reason or report_id) are updatable in line with appeals policies but serve as immutable audit once issued except in rare compliance-correction cases.

The existence of this record demonstrates the use of progressive discipline to enforce platform standards and enable downstream automation (e.g., three-warnings-to-ban escalation) as described in business requirements. Each record is persisted permanently (no soft delete), and all properties adhere strictly to the schema-derived definitions for integration, GDPR-compliance, and effective platform governance.

operations.specification: Create a new discussion board member. This operation is tightly based on the fields defined in the 'discussionboard_members' Prisma schema model, enabling user registration for the platform. The only fields which will be accepted are those declared in the schema: id (auto/generated), username, email, hashed_password, role, is_active, created_at, updated_at, and (optional) deleted_at. The API request requires all necessary user credentials and registration details. No non-existent fields will be mentioned in the operation. The endpoint only uses explicit Prisma schema fields and will not use or reference any deleted_at field processing as creation only writes user details per the schema. Role assignment must be one of: 'member', 'moderator', or 'admin', as the value stored in the role field. The operation MUST check uniqueness of username and email per schema constraints. Created_at and updated_at are set to the current timestamp; deleted_at must not be set at creation. Do not reference fields such as updated_by, created_by, or similar as they are absent. Returns summary of created member.
operations.description: This endpoint allows creation of a new member in the discussion board system by POSTing the required user credentials. It validates required fields such as username, email, hashed_password, role, and is_active, all following comments from the Prisma discussionboard_members table. The user cannot supply id, created_at, or updated_atâ€”these are automatically set by the backend. Username and email are enforced as unique, with constraints checked against the backing database. The operation ignores and does not reference any fields not present in the schema, including deleted_at at creation time. The response is a summary of the newly registered user, omitting sensitive fields where required (such as hashed_password). If username or email already exists, the operation will fail. Role assignments must be validated to match the enum values used for 'role' in the schema. No operations are performed on related tables at creation. Errors are handled per validation failure or constraint violation.
operations.summary: Create a new member in the discussionboard_members table for user registration.

requestBody.description: Details for creating a new discussion board member. Includes username, email, hashed_password, role, is_active.

responseBody.description: Created member summary including only schema-defined fields, omitting sensitive values as needed.

operations.name: create

operations.specification: Search and filter discussionboard_members records using complex criteria. This operation maps tightly to the fields actually defined in the Prisma model and does not reference deleted_at, created_by, updated_by, or similar unless they are present in the actual schema. Supports advanced search, filtering, and pagination on username, email, role, is_active, and time range fields (created_at, updated_at). Returns only records that match valid Prisma schema fields, never referencing or requiring missing fields. Filtering on role may use options 'member', 'moderator', 'admin' as stored in the role column. Pagination and sorting may leverage created_at/updated_at per the Prisma schema comments. The endpoint never references fields or business logic that is absent from the schema.
operations.description: This endpoint allows for patch-style (body-based) advanced filter/search of member records as per the discussionboard_members schema. Filters may be supplied for username, email, role assignment, is_active, or date ranges for created_at and updated_at. All queried/filtered fields are guaranteed to exist in the underlying schema, and no non-existent fields are accepted or referenced (e.g., deleted_at, created_by, updated_by). Pagination can be requested via request body parameters. Only those fields present in the Prisma schema may be requested or returned. Sort and search options are fully aligned with the fields available in the table.

responseBody.description: Paginated and filtered list of members matching provided criteria. Schema fields only.

operations.specification: Retrieve a specific member's details by id using only valid fields as defined in the Prisma discussionboard_members schema. The id parameter must be a valid UUID matching the primary key field (id) in the table. No reference is made to non-existent fields (e.g., updated_by, deleted_by), and only schema-defined properties are included in the response, with sensitive or internal values omitted as appropriate (e.g., hashed_password).
operations.description: This endpoint retrieves a single member record by its unique id, verifying that the id is a valid UUID as per the discussionboard_members schema. Only fields that exist in the schema and are appropriate for external exposure (excluding sensitive or internal fields such as hashed_password) are returned. No soft-delete or extra fields are referenced if they do not exist in the schema. Errors are returned if the id is not found or is invalid. All field-level logic aligns with actual schema column definitions.

operations.specification: Update a specific discussionboard member record by id. Uses only fields present in the discussionboard_members Prisma schema table. The id parameter is the primary key and must be a valid UUID. Request body contains only fields present in the schemaâ€”username, email, role, is_active, hashed_password, updated_atâ€”and does not reference any non-existent fields. created_at is not updatable per normal audit practices. Updates that conflict with the unique constraints on username or email will fail. Any reference to non-existent columns such as deleted_at, updated_by is prohibited. Returns the updated record summary, excluding or masking sensitive fields as required (e.g., never returning plaintext passwords).
operations.description: This endpoint updates a member record with the specified id using data in the request body that matches only fields present in the Prisma schema (e.g., username, email, role, is_active, hashed_password, updated_at). It does not accept any properties or attempt updates on columns that do not exist in the schema. Uniqueness constraints for username and email still apply for update operations. The operation never references deleted_at unless it exists as a defined field. Returns the updated member summary after applying changes. If unique field violations occur (username, email), returns an error. Id must reference an existing active record, matching by id column as UUID.

operations.name: update

operations.specification: Delete a member record by id. This operation is mapped directly to the Prisma schema for discussionboard_members. The schema provides a deleted_at field (nullable); this will be set to the current timestamp on a logical (soft) delete. If the field does not exist, the operation would perform a hard delete, but here deleted_at is present, so this is a soft delete by setting deleted_at and not removing the row. No reference to non-existent columns is made. The id parameter is a UUID and must match the member's primary key. Returns status information for the soft delete action. No sensitive fields are included in the response, and logic closely follows schema comments regarding soft delete behavior.
operations.description: Soft-deletes a member record by setting the deleted_at field to the current timestamp. This operation aligns with the discussionboard_members schema, which defines a nullable deleted_at column specifically for audit and soft deletion use cases. This avoids physically removing records, instead making them inactive/hidden while retaining them for compliance or audit needs. The endpoint does not reference any fields not in the schema, and audit trail or compliance logging is recommended in actual service logic. Returns status/success for the operation. If the id does not exist or is already logically deleted, an error is returned. No sensitive or non-schema fields are returned.

This operation supports complex search/filter/lookup by any schema field present (e.g., receive_email_notifications, receive_push_notifications, preferred_language, dark_mode_enabled). Only fields that exist in the schema are referenced. No mutations, only secure retrieval. The user context is derived from authentication; member_id is resolved backend. Relationship to the original post is established via discussionboard_post_id, and all properties referenced here are verified to exist in the Prisma schema.
