Create a new notification preference setting for a member, tied to specific templates/channels. All writable fields must be those in the discussionboard_notification_preferences table: discussionboard_member_id, code, email_enabled, inapp_enabled, browser_enabled, created_at, updated_at. 
No other fields exist. Member must be authenticated; admin/mod may have access for other members; strict field checking.
operations.description: Creates a notification template/channel preference for a board member, as stored in the discussionboard_notification_preferences table. Supports preferences per template code per channel (email, inapp, browser push), as well as required creation/update timestamps. The request must only reference fields defined in the table. No soft delete or trashing is supported. Returns the created preference entry or validation errors if a duplicate or invalid data is supplied. Admins can create for any member; members can create their own.
operations.summary: Create a notification preference for a member (discussionboard_notification_preferences)

requestBody.description: Details for new notification preference (field values as per schema).

responseBody.description: The new notification preference record created in the DB.

operations.name: create

operations.specification: List and search notification preferences in the discussionboard_notification_preferences table. Admins, or members for their own records, can filter using code, member id, channel enables, and timestamps. Only schema-existing fields may be included: id, discussionboard_member_id, code, email_enabled, inapp_enabled, browser_enabled, created_at, updated_at. Results are paginated and support flexible filtering based on actual fields. No support for deleted records or restore because no such field exists in schema.
operations.description: This operation queries and pages through notification preference records (discussionboard_notification_preferences) by arbitrary search criteria. Supported filters include id, member id (discussionboard_member_id), template code, channel enablement (email_enabled, inapp_enabled, browser_enabled), and created/updated time ranges. Only actual fields in the schema are eligible for search/matching. Output is paginated to support frontend browsing and analytics use cases. Soft/hard delete is not referenced at all since not present in schema.
operations.summary: Paginate/search notification preferences in discussionboard_notification_preferences table

requestBody.description: Filter and pagination info for notification preferences (fields must be schema-correct).

responseBody.description: Paginated list of notification preference records matching criteria.

operations.name: index

operations.specification: Get a specific notification preference record from the discussionboard_notification_preferences table, sourced by unique id. Only fields from schema are returned: id, discussionboard_member_id, code, email_enabled, inapp_enabled, browser_enabled, created_at, updated_at. No delete or history fields exist in the schema, so none are returned or checked.
operations.description: This API fetches all fields for a specific notification preference by its unique id from the discussionboard_notification_preferences table. Returns all columns described in the schema; if no such id is found, an error is returned. The API never references non-existent fields such as deleted_at, historical modifications, or audit trails not present in the actual schema. Permissions restrict to admin, mod, or matching member (for their own record).
operations.summary: Get a single notification preference by id (discussionboard_notification_preferences table)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: UUID identity of the notification preference row to retrieve.

responseBody.description: All field values for the requested notification preference.

operations.name: at

operations.specification: Update a notification preference row in the discussionboard_notification_preferences table by its id. Only actual schema fields may be updated: discussionboard_member_id, code, email_enabled, inapp_enabled, browser_enabled, updated_at. Admins can edit for any member; members their own. The operation does not support soft/hard delete or restore. The path contains the id.
operations.description: This operation updates (PUT) a notification preference record, identified by id, by setting new values for any writable field present in the schema. Permissible target fields: discussionboard_member_id, code, email_enabled, inapp_enabled, browser_enabled, updated_at. Attempts to update non-existent fields will be ignored and lead to validation errors. If id is invalid or not found, an error is returned. Admins have platform-level access; members may update their own preferences only.
operations.summary: Update a notification preference row by id (discussionboard_notification_preferences table)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The notification preference's unique UUID in the DB.

requestBody.description: Fields to update for notification preference. Must match table schema exactly.

responseBody.description: All fields from the updated notification preference row.

operations.name: update

operations.specification: Delete a notification preference row by unique id from the discussionboard_notification_preferences table. The schema does NOT include deleted_at or is_deleted fields, so this is a hard delete. Only admins or matching members can delete their own preferences. No restore/undelete feature is available.
operations.description: Permanently deletes a notification preference identified by id from the notification preference table in the database. Removal is immediate and irreversible. As no soft-delete logic exists in the schema, this is a true hard delete. Records deleted via this endpoint cannot be recovered later. Returns a confirmation or boolean result. Admins have system access; members their own.
operations.summary: Hard delete a notification preference row by id (discussionboard_notification_preferences table)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: UUID of the notification preference entry to be deleted.

responseBody.description: Confirmation of successful hard delete (boolean/status).

operations.name: erase

operations.specification: Create a new privacy policy record in the discussionboard_privacy_policies table. All relevant fields defined in the schema are required: version, effective_date, title, content. created_at and updated_at may be set by DB logic. The API does not and cannot reference deleted, creator, or modifier fields as these are not present. Only admins are authorized to set privacy policy contents.
operations.description: Creates a new privacy policy row in the database containing all required attributes: policy version, effective_date for compliance, title, and full text content of the policy. No deleted or audit-trail fields except for created_at/updated_at, which may be set implicitly. Input must exactly match what is defined in the schemaâ€”no surplus fields allowed. Returns the new privacy policy entry with all details set.
operations.summary: Create a privacy policy (discussionboard_privacy_policies table)

requestBody.description: All information about the privacy policy (schema-based only).

responseBody.description: The new privacy policy record just created.

operations.name: create

operations.specification: Query and page through privacy policy entries in the discussionboard_privacy_policies table. Filtering and sorting may be performed on version, effective_date, title, content, created_at, or updated_at, as those are all actual schema fields. Return values include only actual columns. No delete/restore functionality exists, so no such logic is permissible. Suitable for policy display and audit compliance dashboards.
operations.description: This operation paginates and searches privacy policy records from the privacy policy master table. Filtering and sort operations are allowed only on columns in the schema (version, effective_date, title, content, created_at, updated_at). The result is paginated to support high volume audits and policy history queries. No fields for deletion or row hiding are supported in the schema, so no policy record can be soft/hard deleted using this endpoint.
operations.summary: Search, filter, and paginate privacy policy records (discussionboard_privacy_policies table)

requestBody.description: Filter and pagination instructions for privacy policies (all fields based on schema).

responseBody.description: Paginated/filtered results matching privacy policy query.

operations.name: index

operations.specification: Fetch a single privacy policy from the discussionboard_privacy_policies table by its unique id (UUID). The response includes all schema-present fields for the policy: id, version, effective_date, title, content, created_at, updated_at. No delete or audit/restore logic fields are present in the schema, so cannot be referenced. Admin authentication is required.
operations.description: Retrieves the full privacy policy information for the given id (UUID), returning all first-class fields in the schema. This is used for compliance review, end-user access to policy text, or admin management. If no such id is found, an error is returned. Only strictly schema-defined fields are valid for either query or output. Admin-only API.
operations.summary: Get one privacy policy details by id (discussionboard_privacy_policies table)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: UUID of the privacy policy to retrieve (used as path parameter).

responseBody.description: All fields of the privacy policy row matching id.

operations.name: at

operations.specification: Update an existing privacy policy by ID. This operation modifies the fields of a stored privacy policy, allowing administrators to revise the version, effective date, title, or content. Each policy has atomic fields: id (UUID), version (string), effective_date (DateTime), title (string), content (string), created_at (DateTime), and updated_at (DateTime). Because the schema does not contain any deleted_at or is_deleted field, update is limited to in-place changes and cannot perform soft-restore or soft-delete logic. Only fields present in the schema can be referenced.
operations.description: This endpoint allows administrators to update a privacy policy's details using its unique identifier. The API supports modifications to core fields including the policy's 'version' (which is a unique string for each policy version), 'effective_date' (indicating when the policy becomes active), 'title' and 'content' (which are the main legal text). The update also permits changing auxiliary audit fields like 'created_at' and 'updated_at', if required for system consistency, but does not allow any archiving or soft-delete since 'deleted_at' is not present in this schema. All updates are permanent and immediately reflected in system audit and user-facing retrievals. Attempting to refer to fields not present in the Prisma schema will be rejected. Only an admin user should have access to this endpoint, and all update events should be logged for compliance.
operations.summary: Update an existing privacy policy. (Entity: discussionboard_privacy_policies)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the privacy policy to update.

requestBody.description: Information for updating the privacy policy.

responseBody.description: The updated privacy policy.

operations.name: update

operations.specification: Delete a privacy policy by ID. This operation removes a privacy policy record from the discussionboard_privacy_policies table. No soft-delete or logical delete is possible, as there are no deleted_at or is_deleted fields in the schema. Deletion is permanent and unrecoverable. The primary key is 'id', and the schema also contains fields for version, effective_date, title, content, created_at, and updated_at. Only fields present in the schema can be referenced or used as criteria.
operations.description: This endpoint enables an admin to permanently remove a privacy policy identified by its unique 'id'. The deletion performs a hard delete because the schema defines no soft-delete (like deleted_at or is_deleted), making this action irreversible and removing the record entirely from the database. This is intended for rare administrative actions, such as removing obsolete or mistakenly published legal documents. Attempting to refer to fields or soft-delete logic not present in the schema will result in an error. Only administrators have permissions for this action. Deletion events must be recorded for compliance and audit purposes.
operations.summary: Delete a privacy policy (hard delete). (Entity: discussionboard_privacy_policies)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the privacy policy to delete.

operations.name: erase

operations.specification: Create a new data erasure request. This operation allows a platform member to submit a request to be forgotten, as required by privacy law and compliance. The discussionboard_data_erasure_requests table holds id (UUID), discussionboard_member_id (UUID), status (string), requested_at (DateTime), reviewed_at (DateTime or null), completed_at (DateTime or null), and admin_remark (string or null). Requests will reference only fields in the schema. No deleted_at or is_deleted present, so status transitions are managed only through the status field.
operations.description: This endpoint enables a platform member to initiate a data erasure request. When called, a new record is created in the discussionboard_data_erasure_requests table, storing the member's id (discussionboard_member_id), the status (initially 'pending' or equivalent), the timestamp of request (requested_at), and optionally the review and completion timestamps if available. The request may include or omit admin remarks and will be routed for subsequent moderator/admin processing. Only schema-defined fields can be passed. Field presence and state transitions (e.g., reviewing, completing, denying) are managed through the 'status' string and audit timestamps, not a deleted_at field.
operations.summary: Create a new data erasure request. (Entity: discussionboard_data_erasure_requests)

requestBody.description: Parameters for new data erasure request.

responseBody.description: Created data erasure request record.

operations.name: create

operations.specification: Retrieve a filtered list of data erasure requests using complex search, filtering, and pagination logic. This endpoint uses information in the request body to control search criteria and supports returning paginated response objects. The discussionboard_data_erasure_requests table columns are id, discussionboard_member_id, status, requested_at, reviewed_at, completed_at, and admin_remark. No deleted_at or is_deleted fields exist.
operations.description: This endpoint provides admin or moderator users the ability to retrieve and search through data erasure requests in the platform. Using the request body, callers can specify search filters, sort options, and pagination controls to explore requests by status, member ID, date ranges, etc. Only fields defined in the schema can be used as filter criteria or returned in results. The endpoint returns a paginated list (usually with total counts and results) of erasure request objects, each with atomic fields as defined. No soft-delete or archival logic is present, so all listed requests are from the active records table.
operations.summary: List/search data erasure requests (paged, filtered). (Entity: discussionboard_data_erasure_requests)

requestBody.description: Search and pagination criteria for data erasure request listing.

responseBody.description: Paginated list of data erasure requests.

operations.name: index

operations.specification: Get details for a single data erasure request by its ID. This operation retrieves all atomic fields defined in the schema: id, discussionboard_member_id, status, requested_at, reviewed_at, completed_at, and admin_remark. No deleted_at or is_deleted fields are present; record is returned as-is. Only callable by users with proper admin privileges.
operations.description: This endpoint retrieves the detailed information for a specific data erasure request using its primary key ID. The full record is returned, including the member identifier, current status, timestamps for request, review, and completion, and any admin remarks. As the schema does not use soft deletion, requests are always returned if they exist, with no filtering on deleted_at or similar fields. Only fields present in the database schema are included in the resource representation. Accessible only to admin users for privacy and compliance reasons.
operations.summary: Retrieve single data erasure request by ID. (Entity: discussionboard_data_erasure_requests)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the data erasure request to retrieve.

responseBody.description: Full data erasure request record.

operations.name: at

operations.specification: Update an existing data erasure request by ID. This operation updates any atomic field defined in the schema: discussionboard_member_id (UUID), status (string), requested_at (DateTime), reviewed_at (DateTime or null), completed_at (DateTime or null), admin_remark (string or null). No soft delete fields are present, so update cannot be used to archive; all changes are immediate and permanent.
operations.description: This endpoint allows admins to update an existing data erasure request. The update can set the status string (e.g., to 'approved', 'denied', 'completed'), manage timestamps for review and completion, or supply/update an admin_remark explaining the decision. Because there are no soft delete or archival fields, all updates are reflected directly in the table, and deleted_at or similar cannot be referenced. Each field supplied in the request body must exist in the schema. All changes are permanent and fully auditable, with field-level transitions ideally logged for compliance.
operations.summary: Update an existing data erasure request by ID. (Entity: discussionboard_data_erasure_requests)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the data erasure request to update.

requestBody.description: Updated field values for the erasure request.

responseBody.description: Updated data erasure request record.

operations.name: update

operations.specification: Delete a data erasure request record by ID. This will hard delete the row from the table since no deleted_at or is_deleted field exists. The schema fields: id, discussionboard_member_id, status, requested_at, reviewed_at, completed_at, admin_remark. This operation is intended for admin-only use and should be logged for proper audit and compliance tracking. The resource is unrecoverable after deletion.
operations.description: This endpoint enables an admin to permanently remove a data erasure request from the platform by supplying its ID. Since the schema does not support soft delete, the operation removes the record entirely, making the action irreversible. This action should be performed rarely and only by admins, usually to clean up erroneous or obsolete requests. Only fields present in the schema are referenced, and no soft-delete logic is possible or supported.
operations.summary: Delete a data erasure request (hard delete). (Entity: discussionboard_data_erasure_requests)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the data erasure request to delete.

code.description:
Unique channel code for reference in API/config/logic. Example: 'pol', 'econ'. Channel codes must be unique, short, and facilitate lookup or automation as described in the Prisma schema for 'discussionboard_channels'.

Referenced in UI and logic for organization and navigation. Must be provided explicitly at creation.

name.description: Channel name for display and navigation. Example: 'Politics'. Human-readable label, not derived. Used in forum navigation and UI labeling per schema comments. Required for creation.

oneOf.description:
Expanded channel explanation for user-facing UI and accessibility.

Optional, can give context to UI or help clarify a channel's specific purpose. May be set to null. Matches Prisma column description.

Expanded channel explanation for user-facing UI and accessibility.

Optional, can give context to UI or help clarify a channel's specific purpose. May be set to null. Matches Prisma column description.

description.description:
Expanded channel explanation for user-facing UI and accessibility.

Optional, can give context to UI or help clarify a channel's specific purpose. May be set to null. Matches Prisma column description.

position.description: Channel order in UI or navigation. Used for manual arrangement of channels in administrator UI. Defined as atomic (not calculated), per Prisma schema field comment.

active.description: Is channel active/visible? Enables archiving/soft delete logic as per requirements. Not derived, atomic per schema.

IDiscussionboardChannel.ICreate.description:
Channel creation request for the discussionboard_channels entity.

Based on the Prisma model comments: used to organize top-level discussion boards (such as 'Politics', 'Economics'). Requires unique code, label, optional description, order/position, and active flag. No extraneous properties allowed.

id.description:
Primary key. Unique channel row identifier, as defined in the Prisma schema for 'discussionboard_channels'.

Required for entity retrieval, linking, and audit.

code.description: Unique channel code for reference in API/config/logic. Must be unique and non-null as per schema. Used for programmatic lookup and organization.

name.description: Human-readable channel name label for navigation and display.

oneOf.description: Optional expanded channel explanation, used for accessibility and UI tooltips.
Optional expanded channel explanation, used for accessibility and UI tooltips.

description.description: Optional expanded channel explanation, used for accessibility and UI tooltips.

position.description: UI/manual ordering integer for channels. Lower values generally appear first; not computed.

active.description: Indicates if this channel is currently active/visible for new content. Implements archiving and soft-delete logic (not deletion).

created_at.description: Channel creation timestamp for audit, order, and compliance logging. ISO 8601 UTC timestamp from Prisma schema.

updated_at.description: Last modification timestamp for channel entity. Supports audit and change tracking. Also ISO 8601 UTC.

IDiscussionboardChannel.description: A channel in the forum platform (e.g., 'Politics', 'Economics'). Represents a top-level partition/container for organizing boards and sections, as defined in the Prisma schema 'discussionboard_channels'. Fully describes all atomic fields and audit info. No additional fields present.

Each section is defined by its parent channel, unique code, name, position, and active status. Optional description.

IDiscussionboardThreads.ICreate.description:
Request schema for creating a new thread in the discussion board (discussionboard_threads table). This type represents the data required to initialize a thread, strictly derived from the Prisma schema and ERD.

All properties should be matched to the corresponding columns of the database table, ensuring database-level constraints and business rules. This type omits auto-generated and system-managed fields, and NEVER allows the client to specify actor/ownership fields not in the schema (such as created_by or author_id, unless specifically present). Ownership and timestamps should be system-resolved except where allowed by schema.

- board_id: Board wherein the thread is posted.
- author_member_id: The creator (must match authentication context, not from body in secure production use).
- title: Thread title (must be unique per board, as per Prisma constraint).
- body: Optional description/body content.

board_id.description: UUID referencing the parent board (discussionboard_boards.id). Required by schema, enables navigation and access constraint.

author_member_id.description:
UUID referencing the member (discussionboard_members.id) who creates the thread. Foreign keyâ€”must exist in actors table. Ownership, for audit and moderation.

NOTE: In production, this should ONLY be derived from the authentication context, not settable by the client directly, to prevent impersonation risks.

title.description: Required thread title. Uniquely identifies the thread within a board (enforced by Prisma unique constraint on [board_id, title]). Used for thread navigation and display.

oneOf.description: Optional main thread body/content (nullable in schema). May be omitted if thread is a simple subject line. Used for first-post introduction or context, matched to ERD.

body.description: Optional main thread body/content (nullable in schema). May be omitted if thread is a simple subject line. Used for first-post introduction or context, matched to ERD.

IDiscussionboardThreads.description:
Full thread entity as stored in the discussionboard_threads table. Used for response bodies when retrieving full thread information. Derived strictly from the Prisma schema and ERD. Sensitive/internal fields (such as moderation or deleted_by data) are omitted unless present in the schema.

This type provides all properties available on a normal SELECT; these include linkage, timestamps, and soft deletion tracking if available. NEVER includes password or security fields.

Links to board (by id), author, and version tracking.

- id: Thread UUID.
- board_id: Reference to parent board.
- author_member_id: Author (poster, member).
- title/body: Core content fields.
- created_at/updated_at: Timestamps.
- deleted_at: Null unless soft-deleted.

id.description: Primary key (UUID) for this thread entity.

board_id.description: Foreign key: which board this thread belongs to.

author_member_id.description: Foreign key: authoring member of this thread.

title.description: The thread titleâ€”see schema and requirements for uniqueness and display rules.

oneOf.description: Optional body/description text for the thread subject (nullable in schema, may be empty for brief threads).

body.description: Optional body/description text for the thread subject (nullable in schema, may be empty for brief threads).

created_at.description: Timestamp when this thread was created (ISO 8601 format). Field used for creation ordering, audit, and timeline view.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the most recent edit to this thread. Used for ordering, audit, and UX 'edited' marker.

oneOf.description: Nullable soft delete marker. Set if thread is deleted (moved to deleted state, not removed from DB). Null if live. Field for moderation, audit, or restore.

deleted_at.description: Nullable soft delete marker. Set if thread is deleted (moved to deleted state, not removed from DB). Null if live. Field for moderation, audit, or restore.

IDiscussionboardThreads.IRequest.description:
Thread search/filter/pagination request object. Used in PATCH endpoints to find/filter/list threads in the discussionboard_threads table per business requirements.

Properties provide advanced filtering options: e.g. search by board, author, time window, deletion status. Pagination fields may refer to platform's IPage.IRequest contract.

- board_id: Filter by parent board.
- author_member_id: Filter by author.
- title: Text search (exact/partial).
- created_at_from/created_at_to: Time range boundaries.
- deleted: Boolean toggle to include/exclude soft-deleted records.
- page/limit: Pagination controls.

oneOf.description: Optional: limit to threads within this board.

board_id.description: Optional: limit to threads within this board.

oneOf.description: Optional: filter threads by author id (actor/member).

author_member_id.description: Optional: filter threads by author id (actor/member).

oneOf.description: Optional: Filter by exact or partial match on thread title.

title.description: Optional: Filter by exact or partial match on thread title.

oneOf.description: Optional: lower bound (inclusive) for creation timestamp.

created_at_from.description: Optional: lower bound (inclusive) for creation timestamp.

oneOf.description: Optional: upper bound (inclusive) for creation timestamp.

created_at_to.description: Optional: upper bound (inclusive) for creation timestamp.

oneOf.description: When true, only soft-deleted threads are listed. When false, only non-deleted threads. When omitted/null, both are included.

deleted.description: When true, only soft-deleted threads are listed. When false, only non-deleted threads. When omitted/null, both are included.

oneOf.description: Pagination: Page number (1-based).

page.description: Pagination: Page number (1-based).

oneOf.description: Pagination: Max records per page.

limit.description: Pagination: Max records per page.

IPageIDiscussionboardThreads.description:
A paginated result type of thread entities (IPage<IDiscussionboardThreads>). Standard list view with result array and pagination metadata as in platform IPage contract.

- pagination: Object containing page, limit, total record count, total pages.
- data: Array of thread records for the selected page/filters.

data.description: Array of thread objects for this page.

IDiscussionboardThreads.IUpdate.description:
Patch/update schema for a thread entity in the discussionboard_threads table.

Applicable to PUT/patch endpoints. Only schema-defined fields are included; system or audit fields are not present except as required. For security, client cannot update ownership or audit trail fields directly (e.g., cannot change author_member_id unless allowed by business logic).

- title: Updated thread title.
- body: Updated/overwritten thread body/description.

oneOf.description: (Optional) New/edited title for the thread.

title.description: (Optional) New/edited title for the thread.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Updated thread main content, can be set to null or overwritten.

body.description: (Optional) Updated thread main content, can be set to null or overwritten.

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots.ICreate.description:
Schema for posting a new thread snapshot in the discussionboard_thread_snapshots table.

Records a version of the thread's state at a given point. Used during edit, moderation, or rollback workflows. Only schema columns: thread_id, actor_id, title, optional body, optional reason.

oneOf.description: Optional: UUID of actor (member causing this version). May be system/null if auto-edit.

actor_id.description: Optional: UUID of actor (member causing this version). May be system/null if auto-edit.

title.description: Snapshot of thread title at version point.

oneOf.description: Optional thread body at time of snapshot.

body.description: Optional thread body at time of snapshot.

oneOf.description: Optional moderator/user reason for this snapshot (e.g., edit, rule violation, rollback note).

reason.description: Optional moderator/user reason for this snapshot (e.g., edit, rule violation, rollback note).

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots.description:
Represents a versioned record of a thread's state (discussionboard_thread_snapshots table).

Contains all recorded fields: id, thread_id, actor_id (nullable), title, body (nullable), reason (nullable), created_at.

id.description: Unique id for this snapshot.

oneOf.description: Null/system or actor for this snapshot, if recorded.

actor_id.description: Null/system or actor for this snapshot, if recorded.

title.description: Thread title at this version.

oneOf.description: Thread body at this version.

body.description: Thread body at this version.

oneOf.description: Versioning reason/moderation note/audit field.

reason.description: Versioning reason/moderation note/audit field.

created_at.description: Timestamp this snapshot was created.

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots.IRequest.description:
Request schema for listing/searching thread snapshots (discussionboard_thread_snapshots). Used to filter/audit version history.

Provides filtering/searching by thread, actor, time, and support for pagination.
- thread_id: Filter by target thread.
- actor_id: Filter by editing actor.
- created_at_from/to: Time range narrowing.
- page/limit: Pagination.

oneOf.description: Optional: limit to snapshots for this thread.

thread_id.description: Optional: limit to snapshots for this thread.

oneOf.description: Optional: limit to snapshots created by this actor.

actor_id.description: Optional: limit to snapshots created by this actor.

oneOf.description: Optional: filter snapshots after this date/time.

created_at_from.description: Optional: filter snapshots after this date/time.

oneOf.description: Optional: filter snapshots before this date/time.

created_at_to.description: Optional: filter snapshots before this date/time.

oneOf.description: Pagination: page number.

page.description: Pagination: page number.

oneOf.description: Pagination: max per page.

limit.description: Pagination: max per page.

IPageIDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots.description: Paginated envelope of thread snapshot records (IPage<IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots>). Standard IPage structure: pagination meta + record list.

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshot.IUpdate.description:
Update schema for editing a thread snapshot record. Only updatable schema fields are referenced.

May only permit updates to nullable fields (body, reason); id/thread_id/title are typically immutable for audit compliance.
- body: Corrected/updated version text.
- reason: Clarified/more detailed rationale for versioning.

Note: Edits may be locked in production deployments for audit trust.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Overwrite/correct thread body at this snapshot version.

body.description: (Optional) Overwrite/correct thread body at this snapshot version.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Correction/annotation for version edit reason.

reason.description: (Optional) Correction/annotation for version edit reason.

IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshot.description:
Minimal view for a single thread snapshotâ€”for pure audit or retrieval purposes (IDiscussionboardThreadSnapshots, non-list form). Matches details from the main table.

- id: Unique record.
- thread_id: Parent thread.
- actor_id: Editor (nullable/system).
- title/body/reason: Main fields.
- created_at: Snapshot timestamp.

IDiscussionboardThreadTag.ICreate.description:
Request schema for associating a tag with a thread (discussionboard_thread_tags).

Establishes the M:N relation between a thread and a tag. Only referenced schema fields are present: thread_id and assigned_at are required; removed_at is optional/null for active.

- thread_id: Target thread (UUID).
- assigned_at: Time of tag assignment.
- removed_at: When tag was removed; null if active.

assigned_at.description: When the tag was assigned to the thread (audit/history field).

oneOf.description: When (if) the tag was later removed from this thread. Null if still active.

removed_at.description: When (if) the tag was later removed from this thread. Null if still active.

id.description:
Primary Key. Unique identifier for each thread tag assignment.

This field is a UUID as mandated by the Prisma schema and is used to guarantee uniqueness and referential integrity for each tagging event.

thread_id.description:
Thread reference. Points to the thread this tag assignment is linked to as per database normalization.

Must match a valid thread's UUID from the discussionboard_threads table.

assigned_at.description:
Assignment timestamp, indicating when the tag was applied to the thread. Facilitates time-based analytics and moderation workflows.

Must be an ISO 8601 timestamp.

oneOf.description:
Removal timestamp. If set, represents the point in time when this tag assignment was removed from the thread. Null if tag is still assigned.

Nullable for audit and historical reference.

Removal timestamp. If set, represents the point in time when this tag assignment was removed from the thread. Null if tag is still assigned.

Nullable for audit and historical reference.

removed_at.description:
Removal timestamp. If set, represents the point in time when this tag assignment was removed from the thread. Null if tag is still assigned.

Nullable for audit and historical reference.

IDiscussionboardThreadTag.description:
Thread Tag Assignment entity representing the M:N relationship between threads and tags for discoverability and content organization.

Every instance of this entity records a single assignment or removal event of a tag to a given thread and supports robust audit capabilities. All fields align strictly with the discussionboard_thread_tags table in the Prisma schema.

oneOf.description: Page number, defaults to 1 if not specified.
Page number, defaults to 1 if not specified.

page.description: Page number, defaults to 1 if not specified.

oneOf.description: Number of records per page, defaults to 100 if not specified.
Number of records per page, defaults to 100 if not specified.

limit.description: Number of records per page, defaults to 100 if not specified.

oneOf.description: Optionally filter by thread UUID.
Optionally filter by thread UUID.
Start of assignment timestamp range for filtering.
Start of assignment timestamp range for filtering.

assigned_at_from.description: Start of assignment timestamp range for filtering.

oneOf.description: End of assignment timestamp range for filtering.
End of assignment timestamp range for filtering.

assigned_at_to.description: End of assignment timestamp range for filtering.

IPageIDiscussionboardThreadTag.IRequest.description:
Request parameters for paginating and searching thread tag assignments.

Supports filters for thread ID and assignment timestamps, as well as standard pagination controls.

data.description: Array of thread tag assignment records as defined by IDiscussionboardThreadTag.

IPageIDiscussionboardThreadTag.description: A paginated result object for thread tag assignments, following IPage envelope conventions.

oneOf.description: Thread reference UUID. Can be updated if re-tagging is allowed. Nullable if not provided.
Thread reference UUID. Can be updated if re-tagging is allowed. Nullable if not provided.

thread_id.description: Thread reference UUID. Can be updated if re-tagging is allowed. Nullable if not provided.

The updated assignment timestamp for this record, or null to leave unchanged.

assigned_at.description: The updated assignment timestamp for this record, or null to leave unchanged.

oneOf.description: If set, represents the timestamp when the tag was removed. Null for still-active assignments.
If set, represents the timestamp when the tag was removed. Null for still-active assignments.

removed_at.description: If set, represents the timestamp when the tag was removed. Null for still-active assignments.

IDiscussionboardThreadTag.IUpdate.description:
Fields for updating a thread tag assignment. All properties are optional except for the record identifier in API path.

Only schema-defined fields may be altered.

discussionboard_thread_id.description: Associated thread's UUID. Links the post to the thread for content grouping.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID of the author member creating the post.

discussionboard_board_id.description: UUID of the board where this post is being made. Enforced for topic classification.

title.description: The title or headline for the post, for clarity and discoverability.

body.description: Main post content. Contains full text of the discussion or analysis.

is_deleted.description: Soft-deletion flag. Must be false upon creation. Used for audit and moderation retention.

created_at.description: Creation timestamp for this post (usually set by backend at record insertion).

updated_at.description: Timestamp when post was last updated (equal to created_at on insert).

IDiscussionboardPost.ICreate.description:
Request body for creating a new discussion post as per the normalized schema.

All required fields match the atomic columns of discussionboard_posts with no extra fields permitted.

id.description: Unique post identifier (primary key).

discussionboard_thread_id.description: UUID of the parent thread to which this post belongs.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID of the member who authored this post.

discussionboard_board_id.description: UUID of the board where this post appears.

title.description: Headline/title of the post, for UI and search.

body.description: The main text content for the discussion post.

is_deleted.description: Boolean soft-delete flag. True means the post is logically deleted but retained for audit.

created_at.description: When this post was first created.

updated_at.description: Last time this post was updated.

IDiscussionboardPost.description:
A discussion board post object as returned from the back end, containing only schema-defined columns.

Omitted properties have no presence in the underlying table. All values are fully atomic and non-derived.

oneOf.description: Page number for results, 1-based. Null for default (1).

Max number of records per page. Null/restores to default.

Filter to posts authored by this member UUID.

Optional partial match filter for post titles (UI fulltext/trgm search).

Request body for searching and paginating post objects as defined.

Allows filtering by thread, member, is_deleted, or using title substrings.

data.description: List of post records in the result set.

IPageIDiscussionboardPost.description: Paginated wrapper for discussion board post retrieval results.

Thread reference UUID. To move this post to another thread; null leaves thread unchanged.

Explicit timestamp for update. Usually set to now.

IDiscussionboardPost.IUpdate.description: Update operation object for discussion board posts. All values optional, only schema fields accepted. Omitted if null.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Primary key of the post from which the snapshot is being taken.

oneOf.description: UUID of the member making the edit (nullable for system edits/deleted members).
UUID of the member making the edit (nullable for system edits/deleted members).

editor_member_id.description: UUID of the member making the edit (nullable for system edits/deleted members).

title.description: Snapshot of the title at time of edit/version save.

body.description: Snapshot of the post body at edit/version save.

taken_at.description: The timestamp when this snapshot is recorded.

IPostSnapshot.ICreate.description:
Object for creating a new post snapshot as per the audit/versioning policy.

Captures all relevant fields. 'editor_member_id' is optional (nullable).

id.description: Primary key for the post snapshot entry in the discussionboard_post_snapshots table, used for retrieval, version audit, or rollback.

discussionboard_post_id.description: UUID referencing the parent post whose version this snapshot represents. Required in all version audit, rollback, and compliance queries.

editor_member_id.description: UUID for the member who made the edit, if available (nullable for system-generated). Used for accountability and audit trails. Null when snapshot is created by system/admin. DO NOT expose in cases where this could violate impersonation security policies.

title.description: Snapshot of the post's title as persisted in this version. Atomic and immutable after creation.

body.description: Textual content of the post at this snapshot version. Immutable, for rollback/review purposes.

taken_at.description:
Timestamp recording when the snapshot was taken.

Ensures auditability and enables precise version comparisons/restorations.

IPostSnapshot.description: Represents a historical record of a post's content for audit, rollback, and compliance in the discussion board. Used in version history panels, moderator investigations, and disputed content appeals. All fields are first-class, schema-driven table columns; no sensitive or system-only data included.

oneOf.description: Page number for results (pagination). Default: 1.
Page number for results (pagination). Default: 1.

page.description: Page number for results (pagination). Default: 1.

oneOf.description: Max results per page. Default per API.
Max results per page. Default per API.

limit.description: Max results per page. Default per API.

oneOf.description: Optionally limit to snapshots for a single post.
Optionally limit to snapshots for a single post.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Optionally limit to snapshots for a single post.

oneOf.description: Optionally limit to edits by a single editor/member.
Optionally limit to edits by a single editor/member.

editor_member_id.description: Optionally limit to edits by a single editor/member.

oneOf.description: Range filter: earliest (inclusive) version timestamp.
Range filter: earliest (inclusive) version timestamp.
Range filter: latest (inclusive) version timestamp.
Range filter: latest (inclusive) version timestamp.

IPostSnapshot.IRequest.description: Request object for listing and searching post snapshots. Supports pagination and filtering by post, editor, or version date.

pagination.description:
Page information.

Provides metadata about the current page, total records, page limits, and total pages, following standard discussionboard paging conventions. Supports scalable navigation and administrative review of snapshot version history.

data.description:
List of Post Snapshot records.

Contains the actual post snapshot objects, each of which represents a historical version of a post, including editor, version moment, and snapshot content per the snapshot schema.

IPageIPostSnapshot.description: Paginated result set for Post Snapshot records from the discussion board. Used for audit, rollback, and historical review functionality supporting compliance and advanced moderation workflows. Data is complete for each snapshot, and pagination enables efficient browsing through large version histories.

title.description: Snapshot of the post's title at the current version. Referencing the 'title' column in the discussionboard_post_snapshots schema, this property captures the post's heading as edited for rollback/compliance purposes.

body.description: Snapshot of the post's body content at this version. Matches the 'body' column in the post_snapshots table, for supporting moderation rollback and historical versioning.

taken_at.description:
Timestamp at which the snapshot was recorded, ISO 8601 format.

This field follows the 'taken_at' column in discussionboard_post_snapshots, denoting exactly when the snapshot was created for auditing and history tracking.

editor_member_id.description:
UUID of the member who edited the post at this version, nullable for system intervention.

This property is tied to the 'editor_member_id' column in discussionboard_post_snapshots, and indicates who performed the edit, supporting accountability, moderation, and audit trail.

Never give this property in response types if it refers to sensitive/impersonation data.

IPostSnapshot.IUpdate.description: Object for updating a Post Snapshot record, reflecting only mutable fields defined in the discussionboard_post_snapshots schema. Used for correcting audit errors, resolving moderation escalations, or rare admin operations. Only the directly schema-defined fields are modifiable; the post snapshot is generally considered immutable for typical user workflows.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
UUID referencing the post being voted on.

Implements the 'discussionboard_post_id' column in the discussionboard_post_votes schema. Required for associating the vote with the correct post and auditing the voting flow.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
UUID referencing the member who casts the vote.

Mapped to 'discussionboard_member_id' in the post_votes model, identifies the voter for permissions, uniqueness checks (one vote per member per post), and audit traceability.

oneOf.description:
The type of vote cast: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal.

Directly aligns with the 'vote_type' column (integer) in the discussionboard_post_votes schema, controlling post popularity and engagement analytics.

The type of vote cast: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal.

Directly aligns with the 'vote_type' column (integer) in the discussionboard_post_votes schema, controlling post popularity and engagement analytics.

The type of vote cast: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal.

Directly aligns with the 'vote_type' column (integer) in the discussionboard_post_votes schema, controlling post popularity and engagement analytics.

vote_type.description:
The type of vote cast: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal.

Directly aligns with the 'vote_type' column (integer) in the discussionboard_post_votes schema, controlling post popularity and engagement analytics.

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the vote was cast. Maps to 'created_at' column for audit, temporal analytics, and rate-limiting enforcement.

IPostVote.ICreate.description: Object required to create a new Post Vote record, referencing only properties in the discussionboard_post_votes Prisma schema. Used when a member submits an upvote, downvote, or neutralizes/removes their vote for a post. Submission must comply with the one-vote-per-member-per-post rule, and all fields are audit-critical for engagement monitoring.

id.description: Primary key for the post vote record. Uniquely identifies this vote in the discussionboard_post_votes table.

discussionboard_post_id.description: UUID referencing the post being voted on, as in the 'discussionboard_post_id' schema column. Essential for mapping votes to their respective content items.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID referencing the member who made the vote, matching the 'discussionboard_member_id' schema property. Used in enforcing unique voting, audit, rate limiting.

oneOf.description: Vote value: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal. Follows 'vote_type' column.
Vote value: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal. Follows 'vote_type' column.
Vote value: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal. Follows 'vote_type' column.

vote_type.description: Vote value: 1 for upvote, -1 for downvote, 0 for neutral/removal. Follows 'vote_type' column.

created_at.description: When the vote was created/cast. Matches 'created_at' column, supports time series/analytics.

IPostVote.description: A record representing a single member's upvote, downvote, or neutralization/removal for a post. Covers all schema-present columns and is essential for post engagement tracking, member interaction review, and anti-abuse mechanisms. Never contains derived, sensitive, or non-schema fields.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
Optional filter: target post UUID. Returns votes for this post.

Maps to the 'discussionboard_post_id' column of the post_votes table, enabling analytic or moderation queries for a post's engagement.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
Optional filter: member UUID. Returns votes made by this member, for profile history or moderation.

Refers to 'discussionboard_member_id' in the schema.

oneOf.description: Optional filter: specifies which type of votes to return (upvote, downvote, or neutral). Used for reviewing only positive/negative feedback, or neutralizations.
Optional filter: specifies which type of votes to return (upvote, downvote, or neutral). Used for reviewing only positive/negative feedback, or neutralizations.
Optional filter: specifies which type of votes to return (upvote, downvote, or neutral). Used for reviewing only positive/negative feedback, or neutralizations.

created_at.description: Optional filter: when the vote was cast. Allows time-based analysis in analytic dashboards.

IPostVote.IRequest.description: Request type for searching, filtering, or paginating post vote records. Accepts only fields that exist in the discussionboard_post_votes Prisma schema for secure and type-safe queries.

pagination.description: Metadata about the current page, total records, page count, and limit, supporting navigation through large vote records as per standard paging conventions for scalable retrievals.

data.description: List of post vote records for this page. Each item is a schema-complete description of an individual member's vote on a specific post, audit-ready for administrative or moderator analysis.

IPageIPostVote.description: Paginated result envelope for a list of Post Vote records, providing page navigation details and an array of schema-accurate vote objects for profile, moderation, or analytics use cases.

The updated vote value for this record: 1 (upvote), -1 (downvote), or 0 (neutral).

Follows the 'vote_type' column in post_votes schema. Used by admin/moderator to correct voting actions, handle abuse, or recover from user error.

The updated vote value for this record: 1 (upvote), -1 (downvote), or 0 (neutral).

Follows the 'vote_type' column in post_votes schema. Used by admin/moderator to correct voting actions, handle abuse, or recover from user error.

The updated vote value for this record: 1 (upvote), -1 (downvote), or 0 (neutral).

Follows the 'vote_type' column in post_votes schema. Used by admin/moderator to correct voting actions, handle abuse, or recover from user error.

Follows the 'vote_type' column in post_votes schema. Used by admin/moderator to correct voting actions, handle abuse, or recover from user error.

created_at.description:
The updated timestamp for when the vote was cast (optional, for correcting audit/compliance issues).

Corresponds to the 'created_at' column. Generally modified only by admins/mods.

IPostVote.IUpdate.description: Object used to update a member's vote on a post, only for fields present in the post_votes schema. Allows fixing vote_type due to moderation or error; rarely modified except in compliance scenarios.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
UUID of the post being reported as problematic for moderation workflows.

Implements the 'discussionboard_post_id' column in the post_reports Prisma table. Required for linking the report to the correct post entity.

reporter_member_id.description: UUID of the member filing the report. Follows 'reporter_member_id' column in schema, securing audit trail and enforcing moderation flow rules.

report_type_id.description:
UUID referencing the reason or category for report (e.g., spam, abuse, misinformation).

Maps to the 'report_type_id' schema column, which is a foreign key to the list of allowed report types, enabling analytic breakdown and reporting workflow dispatch.

description.description:
Optional reporter-supplied context or descriptive explanation for the report. Nullable in schema.

Matches the 'description' column; supports nuanced case handling and moderation transparency.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the report was created, as in 'created_at' column. Holds the date/time for reporting, required for audit, compliance, and sequencing moderation reviews.

IPostReport.ICreate.description: Object for creating a new post report record, as stored in the discussionboard_post_reports table. Each field is tied directly to the schema documentation and is critical for ensuring tracing, reporting, and compliance in the moderation workflow. Reports inappropriate, abusive, or spam content on a post for investigation by moderators or admin.

id.description: Primary key for the post report record in the discussionboard_post_reports table. Unique identifier for this individual report.

discussionboard_post_id.description: UUID referencing the reported post. Required for mapping the report within the moderation workflow.

reporter_member_id.description: UUID representing the member who filed this report, as in 'reporter_member_id' column. Needed for moderation/audit transparency.

report_type_id.description: UUID reference to the report reason/category ('report_type_id' column), tied to a valid moderation report type.

description.description: Nullable string: the explanation or context for the report. As in 'description' column. May be empty if report is by quick-action/report button.

created_at.description: Record creation timestamp, ISO 8601, matching 'created_at' column. Required for audit, compliance, and report reviews.

IPostReport.description: Atomic record of a member-submitted report against a post, stored in the discussionboard_post_reports schema. Directly supports content moderation, audit investigation, and anti-abuse policies. Contains all schema-defined fields and no sensitive or non-existent properties.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
Optional filter to get reports for a specific post (UUID).

Used in moderator review queue or post-centric analytics.

reporter_member_id.description:
Optional filter for all reports filed by a particular member.

Tied to 'reporter_member_id' column of the schema.

report_type_id.description:
Optional filter by reason/category of report (as in 'report_type_id' column).

Matches foreign key for type analytics and workflow split.

created_at.description:
Optional filter for timestamp (ISO 8601) when the report was recorded.

Permits analytic/temporal queries in moderation dashboards.

IPostReport.IRequest.description: Request type for searching, filtering, or paginating post report records by schema-supported columns. Used by moderator/admin for compliance, investigation, or workflow management of reported posts.

pagination.description: Metadata for the current page, supporting scaling through large report records as required by moderator/audit access.

data.description: The collection of individual post report records for this page, each matching the schema precisely for audit, review, and workflow triage.

IPageIPostReport.description: Paginated page envelope containing post report records for moderator/admin review. Supports scalable workflows, audit queries, compliance snapshots, and member appeal workflows, all by exposing only schema-present fields.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Optional: update the reported post reference in rare workflows (e.g., admin correction or dispute resolution).

reporter_member_id.description: Optional: update the reporting member reference if correcting administrative errors or transfer of responsibility.

report_type_id.description: Update the category of the report, e.g. if a moderator reclassifies the incident. See report_type_id in schema.

description.description: Allows for editing the explanatory text/context, especially in response to appeals or moderator corrections.

IPostReport.IUpdate.description: Object for updating allowed fields on a post report record. Only modifiable for rare moderation/audit corrections; general user workflows should treat all fields as immutable.

null.description: Represents an empty object or lack of content in a response or request body. Used in endpoints where no body is required or the response is explicitly empty.

source_post_id.description: The UUID of the post that is creating the reference. Required for establishing the source side of the relationship in the post reference table.

oneOf.description: The UUID of the referenced (target) post. If referencing a thread instead, this can be null. This field is optional; used for direct post-to-post references.
The UUID of the referenced (target) post. If referencing a thread instead, this can be null. This field is optional; used for direct post-to-post references.

target_post_id.description: The UUID of the referenced (target) post. If referencing a thread instead, this can be null. This field is optional; used for direct post-to-post references.

oneOf.description: The UUID of the referenced (target) thread. Null when only referencing a post. Used to reference an entire thread from a post when appropriate.
The UUID of the referenced (target) thread. Null when only referencing a post. Used to reference an entire thread from a post when appropriate.

target_thread_id.description: The UUID of the referenced (target) thread. Null when only referencing a post. Used to reference an entire thread from a post when appropriate.

reference_type.description: A string indicating the type of reference (e.g., 'post', 'thread', 'comment'). This informs the system of the relationship's nature. Always required.

IPostReference.ICreate.description: Schema for creating a new entry in the post reference table. Used for establishing a cross-reference between posts or between a post and a thread. All references must correspond to actual other posts or threads.

id.description: The primary key UUID of the post reference record. Unique identifier for the reference relationship.

source_post_id.description: The UUID of the source post (the referencing side) in the discussion board. Corresponds directly to the source_post_id column in the schema.

oneOf.description: The UUID of the target post being referenced. Null when referencing a thread. Optional field depending on the reference type.
The UUID of the target post being referenced. Null when referencing a thread. Optional field depending on the reference type.

target_post_id.description: The UUID of the target post being referenced. Null when referencing a thread. Optional field depending on the reference type.

oneOf.description: The UUID of the target thread being referenced. Null when referencing a post. Optional, used for references to threads.
The UUID of the target thread being referenced. Null when referencing a post. Optional, used for references to threads.

target_thread_id.description: The UUID of the target thread being referenced. Null when referencing a post. Optional, used for references to threads.

reference_type.description: Indicates the type of reference made by the source post. Ex: 'post', 'thread', 'comment'. Directly stored in the reference_type column.

IPostReference.description: A cross-reference entity between posts (and/or threads) within the discussion board. Allows tracking citations, mentions, or related content. All fields are persisted in the post references table, with unique ID and either post or thread target set. Used in citation linking and navigation.

source_post_id.description: Optional UUID filter to find references by source post.

target_post_id.description: Optional UUID filter for references targeting this post.

target_thread_id.description: Optional UUID filter for references targeting this thread.

reference_type.description: Type filter to restrict results to references of a specific type ('post', 'thread', etc.).

IPostReference.IRequest.description: Request body schema for filtering or searching post references. Used for paginated and parameterized listing of cross-reference records from source or target post/thread.

data.description: Array of post reference records returned for the current page.

IPageIPostReference.description: Paginated container for a list of PostReference entities, following the standard IPage<T> interface. Includes pagination info and an array of post reference objects.

source_post_id.description: (Optional) Update the source post reference if changing the referencing post.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Update to another referenced post's UUID; can be null if referencing a thread.
(Optional) Update to another referenced post's UUID; can be null if referencing a thread.

target_post_id.description: (Optional) Update to another referenced post's UUID; can be null if referencing a thread.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Update to another referenced thread's UUID; can be null if only referencing a post.
(Optional) Update to another referenced thread's UUID; can be null if only referencing a post.

target_thread_id.description: (Optional) Update to another referenced thread's UUID; can be null if only referencing a post.

reference_type.description: (Optional) Update the type of reference relationship.

IPostReference.IUpdate.description: Schema for updating fields in a post reference record. Used by moderators or system processes for correcting or altering content relationships and citations.

discussionboard_post_id.description: UUID of the post to which this comment is being added. Required to associate comment with its parent post.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID of the member creating the comment. Must match an existing member record and is required for authorship tracking.

body.description: The main textual content of the comment. Non-nullable and required for all comments.

oneOf.description: Allows this comment to be a reply to another comment. Supply parent comment's UUID. Null for top-level comments.
Allows this comment to be a reply to another comment. Supply parent comment's UUID. Null for top-level comments.

parent_id.description: Allows this comment to be a reply to another comment. Supply parent comment's UUID. Null for top-level comments.

IComment.ICreate.description: Request payload for creating a new comment on a post or as a reply to another comment. All provided fields must match schema types; parent_id is optional for replies.

id.description: Primary key UUID of the comment record. Unique per comment.

discussionboard_post_id.description: UUID of the post this comment belongs to.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID of the member who authored the comment.

oneOf.description: If the comment is a reply, this is the UUID of the parent comment; null for top-level comments.
If the comment is a reply, this is the UUID of the parent comment; null for top-level comments.

parent_id.description: If the comment is a reply, this is the UUID of the parent comment; null for top-level comments.

body.description: The content of the comment at its creation or most recent edit.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the comment was first created, in ISO 8601 format.

oneOf.description: Timestamp for the latest comment update (edit). Null if the comment hasn't been edited.
Timestamp for the latest comment update (edit). Null if the comment hasn't been edited.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for the latest comment update (edit). Null if the comment hasn't been edited.

oneOf.description: Nullable. Soft-deletion marker; when not null, the comment is considered deleted. Used for moderation/audit workflows.
Nullable. Soft-deletion marker; when not null, the comment is considered deleted. Used for moderation/audit workflows.

deleted_at.description: Nullable. Soft-deletion marker; when not null, the comment is considered deleted. Used for moderation/audit workflows.

IComment.description: A comment entity under a post. Contains author, posting, and hierarchy info. Soft-deleted comments are captured by non-null deleted_at. Timestamp fields audit lifecycle and allow moderation tracking.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Filter for comments of a particular post.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Filter for comments authored by a specific member.

parent_id.description: Filter for replies to a specific comment.

body.description: Textual search for comment content, supports partial matches.

created_at_from.description: Lower bound for creation date filtering (ISO 8601).

created_at_to.description: Upper bound for creation date filtering (ISO 8601).

IComment.IRequest.description: Request body for advanced searching/filtering of comments. Supports filtering by parent post, member, parent comment, content, and creation date range.

data.description: Array of comment records for the current page.

IPageIComment.description: Standard paginated result wrapper for comment entities. Includes pagination info and array of comments as per IPage<T> interface.

body.description: Updates the comment content; new textual value replaces the old one.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Change the parent comment, for moving or rethreading; null for top-level.
(Optional) Change the parent comment, for moving or rethreading; null for top-level.

parent_id.description: (Optional) Change the parent comment, for moving or rethreading; null for top-level.

IComment.IUpdate.description: Schema for modifying existing comment records. Permits updates to comment body and reply threading parent; used for member edits or moderation adjustments.

discussionboard_comment_id.description: UUID of the comment for which this snapshot is created. Must reference an existing comment record.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID of the member whose version of the comment is being recorded (author at time of snapshot).

discussionboard_post_id.description: UUID of the parent post at the time of this snapshot. For audit and context.

body.description: Snapshot of the comment's body content at the time of this version.

version.description: Monotonic version number for snapshots of the same comment. Increments per edit/version event.

snapshot_created_at.description: Timestamp when this comment snapshot was created.

IDiscussionboardCommentSnapshot.ICreate.description: Payload for creating a new comment snapshot record. Stores immutable point-in-time version of a user's comment for rollback, audit, and moderation review.

id.description:
Comment snapshot unique identifier.

References the primary key of the snapshot entity from the Prisma schema. Used for retrieving or referencing this snapshot version in audit and moderation workflows.

discussionboard_comment_id.description:
ID of the parent comment this snapshot is versioning.

Acts as a foreign key to the discussionboard_comments table, enforcing normalized snapshot history in the system design.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
ID of the user who authored the comment at the time of this snapshot.

This field allows for historical authorship tracking and supports accurate audit trail reporting when comments are edited or transferred.

discussionboard_post_id.description:
ID of the post under which this comment (snapshot) is associated.

Supports context linking even if post/comment relationships evolve over time.

body.description:
Immutable historical copy of the comment body at this version.

Stores the full comment content for rollback, moderation review, and audit. Preserves original wording even if edited later.

version.description:
Snapshot version number assigned per comment (monotonically increasing per edit event).

Allows for traceable edit history, recovery, and version sequencing. Based on strict normalization rules in DB design.

snapshot_created_at.description:
Timestamp when this snapshot was created.

Used for ordered audit, rollback recovery, and regulatory forensics.

IDiscussionboardCommentSnapshot.description:
Comment Snapshot entity representing an immutable, versioned record of a comment at a point in time.

Defined per the discussionboard_comment_snapshots Prisma schema model, supporting rollback, edit history, and audit trails in discussion moderation workflows.

discussionboard_comment_id.description: Parent comment's ID, to filter snapshots belonging to a given comment.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member ID for filtering snapshots by author at the time of version creation.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Post's ID, allowing filtration of versions for snapshots relating to a specific post.

version.description: Version number to filter for a specific edit version.

snapshot_created_at_from.description: Filter lower bound for snapshot creation datetime.

snapshot_created_at_to.description: Filter upper bound for snapshot creation datetime.

IDiscussionboardCommentSnapshot.IRequest.description:
Request type for searching/filtering comment snapshot records in the discussionboard_comment_snapshots table.

Allows flexible filtering by comment, author, post, version, or created at window, as per API and UI needs.

IPageIDiscussionboardCommentSnapshot.description:
Paginated result container for comment snapshot records.

Wraps a list of snapshots with standard pagination metadata, suitable for advanced UI browses and audits.

body.description:
Revised version of the comment body for the updated snapshot.

Content must comply with community guidelines and moderation rules.

version.description: Manually set or corrected version number for rare admin/appeal workflows only.

IDiscussionboardCommentSnapshot.IUpdate.description:
Update type for modifying allowed mutable fields in a comment snapshot record.

Typically only body and, rarely, version may change. For admin/appeal or audit-correction workflows, not user-level edits.

discussionboard_comment_id.description: ID of the comment being voted on.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Voting member's ID, referencing the actor of this upvote/downvote.

vote_type.description: Vote value ('up', 'down', or other domain-defined string values).

created_at.description: Timestamp the vote was cast.

IDiscussionboardCommentVote.ICreate.description:
Create type for registering a comment vote in the discussionboard_comment_votes table.

Includes all required atomic columns as per schema, supporting voting interactions and analytics workflows.

id.description: Comment vote entity's unique primary key per schema.

discussionboard_comment_id.description: ID of the comment this vote applies to.

discussionboard_member_id.description: ID of the member casting the vote.

vote_type.description: The type/direction of the vote (domain value).

created_at.description: Timestamp of vote creation for analytics/audit.

oneOf.description: Nullable timestamp for when the vote record was last updated, e.g., vote toggles.

updated_at.description: Nullable timestamp for when the vote record was last updated, e.g., vote toggles.

IDiscussionboardCommentVote.description:
Comment Vote entity corresponding to a normalized voting record per comment per member.

Matches the discussionboard_comment_votes Prisma schema for capturing and reviewing upvote/downvote actions.

discussionboard_comment_id.description: Filter by comment ID.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Filter by member ID who voted.

created_at_from.description: Lower datetime bound for creation filter.

IDiscussionboardCommentVote.IRequest.description:
Search/filter request object for bulk comment votes queries.

Supports filtering on comment, voting member, type, and time range.

IPageIDiscussionboardCommentVote.description:
Paginated container for lists of comment votes.

Includes pagination meta and array of comment vote rows for analytics and admin tooling.

vote_type.description: Updated vote value (e.g., 'up', 'down', 'none' to remove vote).

updated_at.description: Timestamp of vote update (e.g., change or retraction).

IDiscussionboardCommentVote.IUpdate.description:
Update structure for editing a comment vote record.

Fields may include vote_type and updated_at for toggling/updating.

discussionboard_comment_id.description: Target comment's UUID being reported.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Reporting member's UUID (actor).

reason.description: Human-readable explanation of the report (required).

created_at.description: Timestamp of report creation.

IDiscussionboardCommentReport.ICreate.description:
Type for submitting a new comment report according to schema normalization rules.

All fields required for audit, moderation workflow, and compliance logging.
