oneOf.description: ID of the associated report that triggered this moderation action, or null if created independently. References the reporting incident that led to this moderation step (nullable according to Prisma schema).

ID of the associated report that triggered this moderation action, or null if created independently. References the reporting incident that led to this moderation step (nullable according to Prisma schema).

report_id.description: ID of the associated report that triggered this moderation action, or null if created independently. References the reporting incident that led to this moderation step (nullable according to Prisma schema).

acting_moderator_id.description: UUID of the moderator or admin performing this action. Foreign key to either the moderator or admin assignment table.

target_object_id.description: UUID of the object being moderated (post, comment, member, board, etc.). This is the direct subject of the moderation action.

target_object_type.description: Type/classification of the object being moderated. Examples: 'post', 'comment', 'member', 'board'. Provides polymorphic reference resolution in moderation workflows.

action_type.description: Type of moderation action being performed. Examples include: 'warn', 'edit', 'delete', 'ban', 'lock', 'pin', etc. Used for audit, analytics, and role-appropriate workflows.

rationale.description: Explanation or justification for why this action was taken. Critical for audit/compliance, escalation review, and appeals. May include member behavior, policy reference, or summarization of investigation.

actioned_at.description: Timestamp when the moderation action was performed. Required for audit trails, SLA compliance, and chronological reporting.

IDiscussionboardModerationAction.ICreate.description: Request body for creating a moderation action in the system. Content and constraints mapped strictly to the discussionboard_moderation_actions Prisma model. All foreign keys and timestamps follow schema documentation. Nullable report_id optionally associates this action to a prior user incident report. Conforms to role-based escalation workflows and compliance/audit rules described in requirements.

id.description: Primary key for the moderation action record, unique identifier. Prisma table column: id.

oneOf.description: ID of the report that prompted the action, or null if this was a proactive or patrol action. Prisma column: report_id.
ID of the report that prompted the action, or null if this was a proactive or patrol action. Prisma column: report_id.

report_id.description: ID of the report that prompted the action, or null if this was a proactive or patrol action. Prisma column: report_id.

acting_moderator_id.description: UUID of the moderator/admin account that performed the action. Prisma column: acting_moderator_id.

target_object_id.description: UUID of the entity being moderated (such as post, comment, or user). Prisma column: target_object_id.

target_object_type.description: Type/classification of the target object. Examples: 'post', 'comment', etc. Prisma column: target_object_type.

action_type.description: Type of moderation action ('warn','edit','delete','ban','lock', etc.). Prisma column: action_type.

rationale.description: Detailed rationale or explanation for this moderation action. For compliance, transparency, and appeals. Prisma column: rationale.

actioned_at.description: Timestamp when the action was taken. For timeline/audit use. Prisma column: actioned_at.

IDiscussionboardModerationAction.description: Represents a moderation action as stored in the database, in direct correspondence with the discussionboard_moderation_actions Prisma schema. Includes polymorphic linkage, audit trail, action metadata, and explanatory rationale per business rules.

oneOf.description: Filter by report ID associated with moderation action (nullable, matches Prisma schema).
Filter by report ID associated with moderation action (nullable, matches Prisma schema).

report_id.description: Filter by report ID associated with moderation action (nullable, matches Prisma schema).

acting_moderator_id.description: Filter to only actions performed by this moderator/admin UUID.

target_object_id.description: Filter by the specific object moderated.

target_object_type.description: Filter by the type/classification of object under moderation.

action_type.description: Filter by type of moderation action, e.g., 'warn', 'edit', 'ban'.

actioned_at_from.description: Lower bound for moderation action date.

actioned_at_to.description: Upper bound for moderation action date.

pagination.description: Pagination parameters (page, limit, etc.).

IDiscussionboardModerationAction.IReques.description: Request object for filtering/searching moderation actions. Supports advanced filtering by fields defined in schema plus optional pagination envelope according to business needs. All filters strictly match schema columns to ensure query compliance.

data.description: List of matching moderation action records for the provided query and pagination envelope.

IPageIDiscussionboardModerationAction.description: Paginated result for moderation action search/list APIs. Data array contains moderation action records, paging metadata in standard format.

oneOf.description: Update the associated report for this action (if any). Nullable per schema.
Update the associated report for this action (if any). Nullable per schema.

report_id.description: Update the associated report for this action (if any). Nullable per schema.

acting_moderator_id.description: UUID of the account performing the updateâ€”typically for audit/audit correction workflows.

target_object_id.description: ID of the new or corrected object under moderation (admin workflows only).

target_object_type.description: (Optional) new or corrected classification for object if amending moderation record.

action_type.description: (Optional) update to moderation action type. Only if justified by error or appeals logic.

rationale.description: Corrected, supplemented or amended rationale for the action (required for audit fixes/appeals).

actioned_at.description: (Optional) new/corrected time of moderation action, for audit consistency.

IDiscussionboardModerationAction.IUpdate.description: Request body to update a moderation action. All fields correspond 1:1 to possible changes in moderation record, as allowed in platform audit flows. Omitted fields are left unchanged. Update permission is strictly admin/moderator only, per requirements. Conforms strictly to actual schema fieldsâ€”never invents non-existent properties.

banned_member_id.description: UUID of the member being banned. Foreign key to member account.

acting_moderator_id.description: UUID of the moderator/admin imposing the ban.

oneOf.description: ID of the report for which this ban was issued (nullable).
ID of the report for which this ban was issued (nullable).

report_id.description: ID of the report for which this ban was issued (nullable).

reason.description: Explanation for banâ€”summarizes the infraction and justification for audit/appeal. Required.

ban_type.description: Type of ban, either 'temporary' or 'permanent'. Directly mapped from business rules.

banned_at.description: When the ban takes effect (ISO8601 UTC timestamp).

oneOf.description: If temporary: when the ban expires (nullable if permanent, as per schema).
If temporary: when the ban expires (nullable if permanent, as per schema).

expires_at.description: If temporary: when the ban expires (nullable if permanent, as per schema).

IDiscussionboardBan.ICreate.description: Request to create a ban (or suspension) for a member. All schema-required fields per discussionboard_bans Prisma model. Bans may be temporary (expires_at set) or permanent (expires_at null). Only actors with moderation/admin roles may create. Rationale for audit, ban escalation, or appeals is mandatory.

id.description: Primary key UUID for this ban record.

banned_member_id.description: ID of the member subjected to the ban.

acting_moderator_id.description: ID of the moderator/admin issuing the ban.

oneOf.description: Reference to the report incident for this ban, or null if initiated proactively.
Reference to the report incident for this ban, or null if initiated proactively.

report_id.description: Reference to the report incident for this ban, or null if initiated proactively.

reason.description: Explanation provided for the ban, as shown in audit trail or appeals review.

ban_type.description: Ban type: 'temporary' or 'permanent', according to escalation process.

oneOf.description: Ban expiry time, if temporary. Null for permanent bans.
Ban expiry time, if temporary. Null for permanent bans.

expires_at.description: Ban expiry time, if temporary. Null for permanent bans.

IDiscussionboardBan.description: Represents a single ban or suspension as issued by moderation. All business logic and timelines correspond to business rule escalation and appeals process. Foreign keys maintained as per schema, reason and time envelope required for audit.

banned_member_id.description: Filter by the banned member UUID. For reviewing all bans against a user.

acting_moderator_id.description: Filter by moderator/admin who imposed the ban.

oneOf.description: Filter by source report for this ban (nullable).
Filter by source report for this ban (nullable).

report_id.description: Filter by source report for this ban (nullable).

banned_at_from.description: Earliest start for ban search window.

banned_at_to.description: Latest end for ban search window.

expires_at_from.description: Min expiry date for ban list, if any.

expires_at_to.description: Max expiry date for ban list, if any.

IDiscussionboardBan.IRequest.description: Request/filter body for searching/listing bans in moderation workflow. All properties map strictly to ban schema for index/search methods. Non-existent properties never invented.

data.description: The array of ban records resulting from the ban query/filter envelope.

IPageIDiscussionboardBan.description: Paginated list of ban results for moderation audit/escalation workflows.

banned_member_id.description: Update the member identifier for the ban (rare, use only in admin schema repairs).

acting_moderator_id.description: Update/override the moderator/admin responsible for this ban.

oneOf.description: Link or update the source report for this ban. Nullable.
Link or update the source report for this ban. Nullable.

report_id.description: Link or update the source report for this ban. Nullable.

reason.description: Update or amend the stated reason for this ban (for audit appeal corrections).

ban_type.description: Update ban type to 'temporary' or 'permanent' if correction needed for business escalation record.

banned_at.description: Correction/update of the ban issue timestamp.

oneOf.description: Update ban expiration to new time (permit extension or early end per appeals). Null for permanent bans.
Update ban expiration to new time (permit extension or early end per appeals). Null for permanent bans.

expires_at.description: Update ban expiration to new time (permit extension or early end per appeals). Null for permanent bans.

IDiscussionboardBan.IUpdate.description: Request for updating a ban record. All parameters must map to existing schema fields for ban entity. This may be used for admin audit corrections or appeals. No non-existent properties allowed.

warned_member_id.description: UUID of the member to be warned. Must reference a real account.

acting_moderator_id.description: UUID of moderator/admin issuing the warning.

oneOf.description: Report record that triggered this warning, or null if not tied to a report.
Report record that triggered this warning, or null if not tied to a report.

report_id.description: Report record that triggered this warning, or null if not tied to a report.

reason.description: Short but complete explanation for the warning, documenting the infraction for compliance, appeals, and member notification.

warned_at.description: When the warning was assigned, as required by audit and escalation timelines.

IDiscussionboardWarning.ICreate.description: Request to create or issue a warning to member, we enforce all business rules for warning/ban escalation as per platform compliance requirements. All fields are mandatory except nullable report_id; only actors with mod/admin roles may create. No unsupported or non-schema properties permitted.

id.description: Unique id for the warning record. Serves as the primary key/audit trace for the escalation pipeline.

warned_member_id.description: UUID of the member to whom the warning applies. Links this warning to user identity and moderation/case history.

acting_moderator_id.description: UUID of the moderator/admin who issued the warning. Provides accidental/action tracing, supports appeals workflows, and is critical for audit logging.

oneOf.description: Linked moderation report (if present) that caused the warning. Nullable for preemptive warnings or evidence-based moderation. Supports platform compliance and audit.
Linked moderation report (if present) that caused the warning. Nullable for preemptive warnings or evidence-based moderation. Supports platform compliance and audit.

report_id.description: Linked moderation report (if present) that caused the warning. Nullable for preemptive warnings or evidence-based moderation. Supports platform compliance and audit.

reason.description: Detailed, user and audit-facing explanation for the warning being issued. Used in escalation, member case summary, and appeal discussions. Example: 'Multiple abusive comments across several threads.'

warned_at.description: Date/time when the warning event occurred. Used as time anchor for escalation policy and audit trace.

IDiscussionboardWarning.description: Atomic warning record for member moderation. All fields map directly to the warnings table in the DB. Used in policy escalation, audit, user notification, and appeals resolution.

warned_member_id.description: Unique identifier (UUID) for the member to be warned. Must reference an existing member in the discussion board system. Used for associating the warning event with the correct actor as per moderation and escalation business rules.

acting_moderator_id.description: Unique identifier (UUID) for the moderator or admin issuing the warning. Used for audit logging and compliance tracking. Must reference a valid moderator/admin.

oneOf.description: Report record (UUID) that caused this warning. Nullable if warning is preemptive or due to off-platform or accumulated evidence. Used to link the warning to the triggering moderation event for audit/compliance.

Report record (UUID) that caused this warning. Nullable if warning is preemptive or due to off-platform or accumulated evidence. Used to link the warning to the triggering moderation event for audit/compliance.

report_id.description: Report record (UUID) that caused this warning. Nullable if warning is preemptive or due to off-platform or accumulated evidence. Used to link the warning to the triggering moderation event for audit/compliance.

reason.description: Textual explanation (required) for why the warning is being issued. Business rules require detailed description of the violation or risk observed so that escalation and appeal flows have the necessary context. Example: 'Repeated spam posting despite prior reminders.'

warned_at.description: Timestamp (ISO 8601 format) when the warning was applied. Used for time-series audit, escalation, and compliance tracking.

IDiscussionboardWarning.IRequest.description: Request body for searching/filtering warning records or creating a new warning in the platform. Fields strictly map to the Prisma schema columns. Used in audit/compliance and escalation review flows. Each property directly references a column in the database tableâ€”no virtual or derived fields present.

data.description: List of warning records for the current page.

IPageIDiscussionboardWarning.description: Paginated result wrapper for warning record queries. Implements platform-wide paging strategy for scalable moderation/audit UIs and backoffice analytics. Each page includes metadata (pagination info) and a list of warning objects as defined in the core model. The schema is used not just for UI, but also for APIs, exports, and cross-service batch integration.

oneOf.description: Target member (UUID) for the warning. Only changed in rare remediation or audit error correction; otherwise, immutable after creation.
Target member (UUID) for the warning. Only changed in rare remediation or audit error correction; otherwise, immutable after creation.

warned_member_id.description: Target member (UUID) for the warning. Only changed in rare remediation or audit error correction; otherwise, immutable after creation.

oneOf.description: Moderator/admin actor (UUID) issuing or updating the warning. Editable if audit/appeals flow requires correction.
Moderator/admin actor (UUID) issuing or updating the warning. Editable if audit/appeals flow requires correction.

acting_moderator_id.description: Moderator/admin actor (UUID) issuing or updating the warning. Editable if audit/appeals flow requires correction.

oneOf.description: Moderation report (UUID) that triggered the warning. Nullable for preemptive admin disciplinary actions. Used for audit trail.
Moderation report (UUID) that triggered the warning. Nullable for preemptive admin disciplinary actions. Used for audit trail.

report_id.description: Moderation report (UUID) that triggered the warning. Nullable for preemptive admin disciplinary actions. Used for audit trail.

oneOf.description: Updated textual explanation for the warning, reflecting new info or appeal reason after audit review.
Updated textual explanation for the warning, reflecting new info or appeal reason after audit review.

reason.description: Updated textual explanation for the warning, reflecting new info or appeal reason after audit review.

oneOf.description: Edit of when the warning was issued (typically only in audit remapping or correction workflows).
Edit of when the warning was issued (typically only in audit remapping or correction workflows).

warned_at.description: Edit of when the warning was issued (typically only in audit remapping or correction workflows).

IDiscussionboardWarning.IUpdate.description: Update type for warning entity. Allows partial updates/patches for appeals, audit corrections, or moderator/admin workflow error remediation. Only schema-present fields may be updated, and all properties are nullable to support PATCH-style update flows in APIs. No delete/restore support as warnings are always atomic and immutable until deleted. All properties map to audit trail requirements in compliance workflows.

success.description: Indicates if the delete operation was confirmed successful.

message.description: Optional explanatory message, e.g., reason for deletion result or details about audit/error handling.

IDeleteConfirmation.description: Delete confirmation response returned when soft/hard delete operations are performed. Standardizes the platform's delete messaging format for consistent handling in all APIs, governance, and client error workflows.

oneOf.description: Target member's UUID for filtering engagement metrics. If null, the filter is not applied and all members are included. Used for DAU/WAU and individual engagement tracking analytics.
Target member's UUID for filtering engagement metrics. If null, the filter is not applied and all members are included. Used for DAU/WAU and individual engagement tracking analytics.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Target member's UUID for filtering engagement metrics. If null, the filter is not applied and all members are included. Used for DAU/WAU and individual engagement tracking analytics.

oneOf.description: Restrict analytics to a specific board (UUID). Nullable for global metric queries. Used by admin analytics panels to break down activity by board.
Restrict analytics to a specific board (UUID). Nullable for global metric queries. Used by admin analytics panels to break down activity by board.

discussionboard_board_id.description: Restrict analytics to a specific board (UUID). Nullable for global metric queries. Used by admin analytics panels to break down activity by board.

oneOf.description: Filter engagement metrics starting from this date (inclusive). Supports dashboard time range selection and heatmaps.
Filter engagement metrics starting from this date (inclusive). Supports dashboard time range selection and heatmaps.

engagement_date_from.description: Filter engagement metrics starting from this date (inclusive). Supports dashboard time range selection and heatmaps.

oneOf.description: Filter engagement metrics up to this date (inclusive). Enables comparative/charts analysis over periods.
Filter engagement metrics up to this date (inclusive). Enables comparative/charts analysis over periods.

engagement_date_to.description: Filter engagement metrics up to this date (inclusive). Enables comparative/charts analysis over periods.

IDiscussionboardEngagementMetric.IReques.description: Request shape for filtering/searching engagement metrics analytics. Every property directly maps to independently indexed columns in the analytics table, supporting slice-and-dice UI, heatmap queries, time-series, and cohort dashboards. Nulls allow for unconstrained (global) queries.

data.description: Engagement metrics records for the current page.

IPageIDiscussionboardEngagementMetric.description: Paginated result container for analytics dashboard queries and bulk-export scenarios. The IPage wrapper allows for efficient front-end pagination, reporting, and export mechanisms. The core analytics metric properties can be further filtered by request shape.

id.description: Unique identifier for the engagement metric record.

oneOf.description: Optional member UUID for individual engagement. Null for anonymous or aggregate data.
Optional member UUID for individual engagement. Null for anonymous or aggregate data.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Optional member UUID for individual engagement. Null for anonymous or aggregate data.

oneOf.description: Board context for the engagement metric. Null if metric is board-agnostic.
Board context for the engagement metric. Null if metric is board-agnostic.

discussionboard_board_id.description: Board context for the engagement metric. Null if metric is board-agnostic.

engagement_date.description: Timestamp for the metrics aggregation bucket.

posts_created_count.description: Total posts created in this period for the metric row.

comments_created_count.description: Total comments created in this period for the metric row.

votes_cast_count.description: Total voting actions cast in this period for the metric row.

IDiscussionboardEngagementMetric.description: Atomic row representing engagement activity for a specific user or board in a specific time period; used to build analytics, trend charts, and cohort dashboards.

oneOf.description: Search for activity logs from actions by a specific member (UUID). Null means all users.
Search for activity logs from actions by a specific member (UUID). Null means all users.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Search for activity logs from actions by a specific member (UUID). Null means all users.

oneOf.description: Restrict logs to a specific board (UUID). Ideal for trending/board usage tracking.
Restrict logs to a specific board (UUID). Ideal for trending/board usage tracking.

discussionboard_board_id.description: Restrict logs to a specific board (UUID). Ideal for trending/board usage tracking.

oneOf.description: Filter down to logs related to a certain thread id (UUID).
Filter down to logs related to a certain thread id (UUID).

discussionboard_thread_id.description: Filter down to logs related to a certain thread id (UUID).

oneOf.description: Only logs about actions involving this post (UUID). Used for post-level audit review.
Only logs about actions involving this post (UUID). Used for post-level audit review.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Only logs about actions involving this post (UUID). Used for post-level audit review.

oneOf.description: Limit activity logs to comments on this id (UUID).
Limit activity logs to comments on this id (UUID).

discussionboard_comment_id.description: Limit activity logs to comments on this id (UUID).

oneOf.description: Type of activity (e.g., 'login', 'post_create'). Null disables this filter.
Type of activity (e.g., 'login', 'post_create'). Null disables this filter.

event_type.description: Type of activity (e.g., 'login', 'post_create'). Null disables this filter.

oneOf.description: Start timestamp for activity log filtering.
Start timestamp for activity log filtering.

event_timestamp_from.description: Start timestamp for activity log filtering.

oneOf.description: End (inclusive) timestamp for activity log filtering.
End (inclusive) timestamp for activity log filtering.

event_timestamp_to.description: End (inclusive) timestamp for activity log filtering.

IDiscussionboardActivityLog.IRequest.description: Request schema for filtering/searching raw activity log events. Allows for fine-grained audit, analytics, anomaly detection, and event drill-down analysis per requirements documentation. Null fields expand to global search. All fields map to indexed columns.

data.description: Array of raw activity log events matching query for analytics, audit, or heatmap display.

IPageIDiscussionboardActivityLog.description: Paginated result structure for efficient front-end consumption and high-volume analytics dashboard queries. Used in activity heatmaps, rare journey tracking, and anomaly investigation workflows.

id.description: Unique id for the activity log record. Each log represents a single user/system event.

oneOf.description: Member context for the event. Nullable for anonymous/system-origin events.
Member context for the event. Nullable for anonymous/system-origin events.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member context for the event. Nullable for anonymous/system-origin events.

oneOf.description: Optional board context for the event (UUID).
Optional board context for the event (UUID).

discussionboard_board_id.description: Optional board context for the event (UUID).

oneOf.description: Optional thread context (UUID) for the log event.
Optional thread context (UUID) for the log event.

discussionboard_thread_id.description: Optional thread context (UUID) for the log event.

oneOf.description: Optional post context (UUID) for the log event.
Optional post context (UUID) for the log event.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Optional post context (UUID) for the log event.

oneOf.description: Optional comment context (UUID) for the log event.
Optional comment context (UUID) for the log event.

discussionboard_comment_id.description: Optional comment context (UUID) for the log event.

event_timestamp.description: Timestamp for the event. Required for analytics, audit trail, and system time-series visualizations.

event_type.description: Activity type/tag for the event (login, post_create, ban, etc.).

oneOf.description: Arbitrary context JSON (stringified) for additional event metadata or payloads.
Arbitrary context JSON (stringified) for additional event metadata or payloads.

event_metadata.description: Arbitrary context JSON (stringified) for additional event metadata or payloads.

IDiscussionboardActivityLog.description: Single event row as stored in the normalized audit/event tracking table. Used for anomaly detection, rare journey trace, and compliance audits. Every property is directly linked to a schema column.

oneOf.description: Query for trending topic results for only this thread (UUID). Null = unconstrained.
Query for trending topic results for only this thread (UUID). Null = unconstrained.

discussionboard_thread_id.description: Query for trending topic results for only this thread (UUID). Null = unconstrained.

oneOf.description: Filter to a particular board's trending topics (UUID). Null disables constraint and yields aggregate.
Filter to a particular board's trending topics (UUID). Null disables constraint and yields aggregate.

discussionboard_board_id.description: Filter to a particular board's trending topics (UUID). Null disables constraint and yields aggregate.

oneOf.description: Lower bound for ranking period (inclusive) for trend querying (date/time, ISO8601).
Lower bound for ranking period (inclusive) for trend querying (date/time, ISO8601).

ranking_period_date_from.description: Lower bound for ranking period (inclusive) for trend querying (date/time, ISO8601).

oneOf.description: Upper bound for ranking period.
Upper bound for ranking period.

IDiscussionboardTrendingTopic.IRequest.description: Request schema for paginated/filter search for trending topics by thread, board, or ranking period. Every property is schema-indexed to arbitrate analytics widgets/reports.

data.description: Trend topic records for current page, as required by analytics dashboard UI.

IPageIDiscussionboardTrendingTopic.description: Paginated trend topic analytics results as returned from trending_topcis table queries. Used for homepage highlights, analytic dashboards, and moderation workflow for hot topics.

id.description:
Unique identifier for each trending topic record, referenced throughout the analytics/trending subsystems of the forum platform. Sourced from the discussionboard_trending_topics table, this field provides a single, atomic PK for each daily or periodic trending score. Never null or re-used.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.id

discussionboard_thread_id.description:
Foreign key reference to the thread judged trending (discussionboard_threads.id). This attribute fulfills the connection between analytics and user discussion content, supporting UI panels, notification engines, and audit trails.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.discussionboard_thread_id

discussionboard_board_id.description:
Foreign key reference to the board (discussionboard_boards.id) under which the trending topic is computed and visualized. Enables board-level trending panels and analytics breakdowns for navigation purposes.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.discussionboard_board_id

ranking_period_date.description:
Date/time value representing the period for which the topic is trending (e.g., daily partition). Supports analytics roll-ups and enables accurate visualizations across dashboards.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.ranking_period_date

trending_score.description:
Quantitative value reflecting engagement weight, as calculated by analytics engine or background jobs, relative to a forum thread within the period. Used for ordering trending results and alerting moderation.

@see discussionboard_trending_topics.trending_score

IDiscussionboardTrendingTopic.description: Represents a single trending topic as calculated for analytics and trending panels. Sourced from the discussionboard_trending_topics Prisma table and referenced in the analytics and moderation dashboards. Contains quantitative and relational fields crucial for surfacing active forum subjects.

code.description:

name.description:

oneOf.description:

description.description:
Long-form description for admins/moderators clarifying the purpose of the template, its context, and operational constraints. Optional.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.description

subject.description:
Subject line for notification messages using this template. Required for all standard notification template creation.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.subject

body.description:
The template body in full, including parameter placeholders. Not nullable.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.body

is_active.description: Determines template availability for notification triggering (enabled/disabled for API use; required as a direct field @see discussionboard_notification_templates.is_active).

IDiscussionboardNotificationTemplate.ICr.description: Request body for creating a new notification message template. All major business and audit fields for template creation are present and values must conform to discussionboard_notification_templates Prisma schema.

id.description:

name.description:

oneOf.description:

description.description:
Long-form (optional) explanation for admin reference, describing template's intent, scope, and usage notes for future support.

@see discussionboard_notification_templates.description

subject.description:
Actual subject line as rendered to users in emails or push notifications. Supports personalization markup as necessary.

body.description:
Text or markup field containing the message body, possibly with template placeholders for personalization. Required as non-null.

is_active.description:
Flag determining whether this template is currently available for use in notifications. Admin/moderator toggles are provided via this field.

IDiscussionboardNotificationTemplate.description: Notification template entity containing all schema-compliant fields as stored in the discussionboard_notification_templates table. Used for display, auditing, and notification rendering workflows.

subject.description: Optionally filter or search for templates based on subject line substrings or fuzzy match.

is_active.description: Enables filtering templates by their active state (true for currently enabled, false for disabled/inactive).

created_at_to.description: Returns templates created before this timestamp for bounded-date queries.

updated_at_from.description: Filters templates updated after this time for change/recent edit review.

updated_at_to.description: Filters templates updated before this value for change window search.

limit.description: Number of results per page for pagination.

inapp_enabled.description: Specifies whether in-app/bell notifications are enabled for this template and user.

browser_enabled.description: Specifies whether browser push notifications are enabled for this template and user.

updated_at.description: Timestamp for last change of this notification preference record.

created_at_to.description: Returns rows with created_at <= this value for bounded queries.

IPageDiscussionboardNotificationPreferen.description: Paginated response envelope for notification preference browse/search APIs.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
The unique identifier for the member (user) whose notification/channel preference is being updated. This field links the notification preference record to the appropriate user entity (see Actors component). Set automatically when members update their own preferences; may be required/admin-editable for administrative updates.

References the member's id in the 'discussionboard_members' table as a foreign key. Used for scoping this preference to a particular user. Always a UUID value.

code.description:
Notification Template Code. Specifies for which template or notification topic this preference applies (e.g., 'thread_reply', 'mention_alert'). Must correspond to a valid notification template code in the system.

Ensures preferences are associated with specific system messages and supports granular per-template and per-channel controls. Follows normalized notification management as described in the main requirements and schema docs. Typically unique per (member_id, code) pair.

email_enabled.description: True if email notifications for this template/code are enabled for this member; false if email should not be sent for this topic. Implements member-level custom delivery control: users may opt in or out of email for each notification scenario. Used to comply with privacy and anti-spam regulations.

inapp_enabled.description: True if in-app/bell notifications are enabled for this code for this member; false otherwise. Allows members to suppress or enable UI notification pop-ups or notification center entries for specific templates. Implements fine-grained control and aligns with system notification behaviour.

browser_enabled.description: True if browser push notifications should be used for this template/code. Gives the user full choice over using browser-based push notifications for the associated topic. Integral part of user experience customization.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this notification preference was created. Required for compliance and audit. Follows standard ISO 8601 date-time format as described in the schema.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp for the latest modification to this preference record. Updated automatically when member or admin changes preferences. Enforces audit/compliance as required by system policies.

ISO 8601 format.

IDiscussionboardNotificationPreference.I.description:
Request body or update object schema for updating a discussion board notification preference. This type describes the fields a member or admin is allowed to update on a notification preference record, supporting granular per-template/per-channel opt-in/opt-out of notification delivery channels (email, in-app, browser push).

Each field is explained in context of notification routing as outlined in the requirements and schema documentation. All references are to system-internal ids and codes, following normalized notification and preference models. The business rules require that any updates to notification preferences pass the full set of schema validations (UUIDs, code structure, booleans). This component is integral to notification settings panels, privacy controls, and compliance dashboards for the discussion board platform.

version.description:
Policy version identifier.

A unique, structured identifier describing the version of the privacy policy (e.g., 'v2024.06'). Must be unique and is referenced in logs, consent, and audit trails. Required by the business for regulatory compliance and historical review.

effective_date.description:
Effective start date for this policy version.

Must be in ISO 8601 date-time format and represents the timestamp when this policy becomes active. Required for regulatory time-based traceability and determines which version is active when a user joins.

title.description:
Policy title/heading.

A short, descriptive title for this version of the privacy policy (e.g., "Discussion Board Privacy Statement - 2025 Update"). Used to identify the policy in UI listings and legal documents.

content.description:
Full legal/privacy policy text.

The full authoritative text of the privacy and data protection policy as required by law and business rules. Displayed to users in legal/compliance interfaces, never truncated or summarized.

IDiscussionboardPrivacyPolicy.ICreate.description:
Creation object for a new privacy policy version.

All fields are required to establish a legally binding and traceable policy entry. Each record is immutable and a new version is inserted when updating. This structure is compliant with business/legal audits.

id.description:
Primary Key: Unique identifier for this privacy policy version.

Auto-generated and used for system/DB reference.

version.description:
Policy version string (e.g., 'v2024.06').

Uniquely identifies each version for historical lookup, database audit, and user consent verification.

effective_date.description:
Datetime this policy became effective (ISO 8601).

Used for time-based compliance, determining which policy covers a user at the time of their consent/account creation.

title.description:
Short heading/title for the privacy policy.

Displayable in UI and referenced in logs, user audit/history workflows.

content.description:
Full policy text.

Authoritative and complete legal description for data use, rights, retention, and other privacy matters.

created_at.description:
Creation timestamp for this policy version (ISO 8601).

Database/audit field for record keeping.

updated_at.description:
Last update timestamp for this record.

Audit field for history/compliance; updates only on changes to this row.

authorization.name: member
authorization.description: Can register, log in, view discussion boards, post new topics, comment, and interact with posts (like/upvote/downvote).

authorization.name: moderator
authorization.description: Can do everything a member can, plus has the ability to edit/delete posts, manage reported content, and temporarily ban members for violations.

authorization.name: admin
authorization.description: Full platform control: includes all moderator functions, user management, board configuration, role assignment, and system settings.
